Reinicke)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f206337aee6a87910677a52?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn96@2020_6/2020/08/31/17-21-56-934_9165bbdd105fa84f.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f4d2bd960bf1f00280797ed?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn43@2020_2/2020/08/31/17-22-12-772_00bc8b9a21d063c4.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn51@2020_3/2020/08/31/17-22-14-421_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=KTlmiN3b5Nk:utN0fMhaAek:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn83@2020_3/2020/08/31/17-22-05-855_325da4094cb3c924.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=KTlmiN3b5Nk:utN0fMhaAek:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn60@2020_2/2020/08/31/17-22-11-568_7da9d09281c93f11.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn76@2020_1/2020/08/31/17-22-07-798_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=KTlmiN3b5Nk:utN0fMhaAek:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn100@2020_3/2020/08/31/17-22-12-152_cab618734e106a1c.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/KTlmiN3b5Nk":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn40@2020_4/2020/08/31/17-22-03-730_f7d20cf3852e4eee.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598894512848},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 01:21:52","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 01:21:52","title":"11 of the best Yale classes you can take online for free — including the most popular course in the university's history","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/yale-free-online-courses","description":"<p class=\"financial-disclaimer\"><i>When you buy through our links, we may earn money from our affiliate partners. <a href=\"https://www.insider-inc.com/commerce-on-insider-inc/\">Learn more.</a></i></p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f457e8242f43f001ddff037?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Free online courses Yale\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Pixabay/Pexels</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li><strong>Yale University offers a selection of its courses for free or for cheap online.</strong></li><li><strong><a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&mid=40328&murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.coursera.org%2Fa.org%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Coursera</a> hosts several Yale courses that mimic in-classroom settings. They're typically free to audit, but come with a $49 fee for features like graded homework or a certificate of completion.</strong></li><li><strong>Below, you can find a selection of the most popular <a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&mid=40328&murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.coursera.org%2Fyaleg%2Fyale\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Yale courses on Coursera</a>, with topics ranging from behavioral finance principles to the science of being happier right now.</strong></li><li><strong>If your educational plan for 2020 includes paying for multiple classes on Coursera, check out its <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com/?id=35871X943606&isjs=1&jv=14.2.0-stackpath&sref=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.businessinsider.com%2Fcoursera-plus&url=https%3A%2F%2Fclick.linksynergy.com%2Fdeeplink%3Fid%3DEHFxW6yx8Uo%26mid%3D40328%26murl%3Dhttps%253A%252F%252Fwww.coursera.org%252Fcourseraplus%26u1%3D1598547824999al5wjn5qx&xguid=&xs=1&xtz=240&xuuid=0b4e373afbf6b7c6ce043ffce9879c70&xjsf=other_click__contextmenu%20%5B0%5Df=other_click__contextmenu%20%5B0%5D\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">new $399 annual membership</a>, which could wind up being a better deal.&#160;</strong></li></ul><p>Thanks to the internet and MOOC (massive open online courses) culture, it's not hard to find courses from <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/free-online-courses-from-best-colleges\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">prestigious universities</a> such as Yale online for free or cheap. Counter to the Ivy League's legacy of exclusivity, MOOCs are designed to remove traditional education barriers: price and location.&#160;</p><p>In fact, Yale offers access to a handful of recorded in-person courses such as <a href=\"https://oyc.yale.edu/african-american-studies/afam-162\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">African American History: From Emancipation to the Present</a> via <a href=\"https://oyc.yale.edu/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Open Yale Courses</a>, a platform where anyone can access the lectures. However, lecture-listeners won't earn course credit, degrees, or a certificate of completion.&#160;</p><p>If you're looking for a classroom-like educational experience with more structure, feedback, and peers, you'll want to turn to Coursera. The online learning platform features <a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&mid=40328&murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.coursera.org%2Fyaleg%2Fyale\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">more than a dozen Yale courses</a> that range in topic from economics to parenting to happiness.</p><bi-shortcode id=\"related-article-module\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-type=\"5e3308685bc79c385f092a98\" data-title=\"54 free online courses from the best colleges in the US — including Princeton, Harvard, and YaleYale\" data-url=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/free-online-courses-from-best-colleges\" data-thumbnail=\"https://i.insider.com/5e3321db62fa816cb05c6a76\" data-shortcode-display-text=\"Related Article Module: 54 free online courses from the best colleges in the US — including Princeton, Harvard, and YaleYale\">&#160;</bi-shortcode><p>Coursera classes typically include video lectures, resources, community discussions, and quizzes. They're free to enroll in, but you'll have to pay a low fee (starting at $49) for features like graded homework assignments or certificates of completion, which can be added to a LinkedIn page. While most courses are available in English, you'll also find a couple of popular Yale courses taught primarily in <a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&mid=40328&murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.coursera.org%2Flearn%2Fnegotiation-aration-ar\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Arabic</a> and <a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&mid=40328&murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.coursera.org%2Flearn%2Fyuzhou-zhi-luu-zhi-lu\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Chinese</a>.</p><p>If you plan on paying to enroll in multiple courses over the course of the year, you may want to look into <a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&mid=40328&murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.coursera.org%2Fcourseraplus&u1=1598886147867amcthp3ln|xid:fr1598886152642abf886152642abf\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Coursera Plus</a>. The $399 annual subscription gives its members unlimited access to over 90% of the platform's online courses (over 3,000 classes). Depending on your needs, you may end up saving money.&#160;</p><h2><strong>Read on for 11 of the most popular Yale University courses you can enroll in online for free:</strong></h2>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tFinancial Markets\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f457c6d89aff80028ab7e77?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Yale courses 1\" height=\"751\" width=\"1000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Karoline Grabowska/Pexels</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&#38;mid=40328&#38;murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.coursera.org%2Flearn%2Ffinancial-markets-global\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Free to audit, $49 for full access</a></h3><p>This course, taught by Yale economics professor Robert Shiller, is an introduction to risk management and behavioral finance principles so students can better understand securities, insurance, and banking industries in the real world.</p><p>The class places an emphasis on \"financially-savvy leadership skills\" and is structured around the goal of using these industries effectively and in the service of a better society.&#160;</p><p>This course should take approximately 27 hours to complete.</p><p><strong>Note: This course is included in <a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&#38;mid=40328&#38;murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.coursera.org%2Fcourseraplus&#38;u1=1598886147867amcthp3ln|xid:fr1598886152642abf\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Coursera Plus</a>. It's also eligible for financial aid.</strong></p>\n\tThe Science of Well-Being\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f457c7a89aff80028ab7e78?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Yale online courses slide 2 credit\" height=\"1500\" width=\"1999\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Andrea Piacquadio/Pexels</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&#38;mid=40328&#38;murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.coursera.org%2Flearn%2Fthe-science-of-well-being\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Free to audit, $49 for full access</a></h3><p>Based on the most popular course in Yale's history, this class combines positive psychology with the real-life applications of behavioral science to increase your own happiness using concrete, productive habits.&#160;</p><p>Read our <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/coursera-yale-science-of-wellbeing-free-course-review-overview\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">full review of The Science of Well-Being course here</a>. For tips on how to improve your happiness in the era of social distancing, read our interview with the course professor, Lori Santos, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/yale-professor-of-happiness-course-shares-advice-on-how-to-be-happy\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</a>.</p><p><strong>Note: This course is included in <a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&#38;mid=40328&#38;murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.coursera.org%2Fcourseraplus&#38;u1=1598886147867amcthp3ln|xid:fr1598886152642abf\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Coursera Plus</a>. It's also eligible for financial aid.</strong></p>\n\tIntroduction to Negotiation\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f457beb89aff80028ab7e73?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Yale online courses 3\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">mentatdgt/Pexels</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&#38;mid=40328&#38;murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.coursera.org%2Flearn%2Fnegotiation\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Free to audit, $49 for full access</a></h3><p>Designed to help students build a framework for analyzing and structuring negotiations, this class includes real-world opportunities to negotiate with other students using case studies that are based on common situations experienced in both business and life.</p><p>Students can receive feedback on their performance, as well as compare their arguments to those of their peers. Course topics range from preparing for a negotiation to making ultimatums. The course will also offer insight into more complex situations, such as negotiating when you have no power, negotiating over email, and the role of gender differences in negotiation.&#160;</p><p>This course takes approximately 28 hours to complete.</p><p><strong>Note: This course is included in <a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&#38;mid=40328&#38;murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.coursera.org%2Fcourseraplus&#38;u1=1598886147867amcthp3ln|xid:fr1598886152642abf\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Coursera Plus</a>. It's also eligible for financial aid.</strong></p><p>&#160;</p>\n\tIntroduction to Psychology\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f457c8a42f43f001ddff024?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Yale online courses 4\" height=\"1499\" width=\"1998\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Karoline Grabowska/Pexels</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&#38;mid=40328&#38;murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.coursera.org%2Flearn%2Fintroduction-psychology\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Free to audit, $49 for full access</a></h3><p>This intro class aims to give students a comprehensive overview of the scientific study of thought and behavior. Course topics include perception, communication, learning, memory, decision-making, persuasion, emotions, and social behavior.</p><p>Students will look at how these aspects are affected by variables like development and illness, and grapple with tough questions like \"What makes us happy?\"</p><p>This course should take approximately 15 hours to complete.</p><p><strong>Note: This course is included in <a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&#38;mid=40328&#38;murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.coursera.org%2Fcourseraplus&#38;u1=1598886147867amcthp3ln|xid:fr1598886152642abf\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Coursera Plus</a>. It's also eligible for financial aid.</strong></p>\n\tMoral Foundations of Politics\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f457c5942f43f001ddff022?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Yale online courses 5\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Aaron Kitteredge/Pexels</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&#38;mid=40328&#38;murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.coursera.org%2Flearn%2Fmoral-politics\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Free to audit, $49 for full access</a></h3><p>\"When do governments deserve our allegiance, and when should they be denied it?\"</p><p>Yale Professor of Political Science Ian Shapiro delves into how the modern West has responded to this question. Students will survey the major political theories of the Enlightenment, as well as the later rejection of Enlightenment political thinking. The class also covers how democratic politics relate to Enlightenment and Anti-Enlightenment political thinking.</p><p>Students will consider the practical implications of the diverse theories through debates on concrete problems such as economic inequality, affirmative action, the distribution of health care, and more.</p><p>This course should take approximately 44 hours to complete.</p><p><strong>Note: This course is included in <a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&#38;mid=40328&#38;murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.coursera.org%2Fcourseraplus&#38;u1=1598886147867amcthp3ln|xid:fr1598886152642abf\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Coursera Plus</a>. It's also eligible for financial aid.</strong></p><p>&#160;</p>\n\tThe Global Financial Crisis\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f457c9989aff80028ab7e79?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Yale online courses 6\" height=\"1500\" width=\"1999\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Pixabay/Pexels</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&#38;mid=40328&#38;murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.coursera.org%2Flearn%2Fglobal-financial-crisis\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Free to audit, $49 for full access</a></h3><p>Former US Secretary of the Treasury Timothy F. Geithner and Professor Andrew Metrick survey the causes, events, policy responses, and aftermath of the recent global financial crisis &#8212; as well as applying lessons we've learned to any future crises.</p><p>Topics include housing and mortgages, safe assets and the global savings glut, anxiety, and more.</p><p>This course should take approximately 24 hours to complete.</p><p><strong>Note: This course is included in <a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&#38;mid=40328&#38;murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.coursera.org%2Fcourseraplus&#38;u1=1598886147867amcthp3ln|xid:fr1598886152642abf\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Coursera Plus</a>.</strong></p>\n\tEveryday Parenting: The ABCs of Child Rearing\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f457ca542f43f001ddff025?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Yale online courses 7\" height=\"751\" width=\"1000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Tatiana Syrikova/Pexels</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&#38;mid=40328&#38;murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.coursera.org%2Flearn%2Feveryday-parenting\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Free to audit, $49 for full access</a></h3><p>In this course, Dr. Alan E. Kazdin, Professor of Psychology and Child Psychiatry, offers step-by-step instructions for building ideal behaviors in children and adolescents. He also addresses common parenting misconceptions and ineffective strategies.</p><p>Among many other techniques, students will learn that simple modifications to tone of voice and phrasing can be highly effective.</p><p>This course should take approximately 13 hours to complete.</p><p><strong>Note: This course is included in <a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&#38;mid=40328&#38;murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.coursera.org%2Fcourseraplus&#38;u1=1598886147867amcthp3ln|xid:fr1598886152642abf\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Coursera Plus</a>. Subtitles are available in Chinese and Spanish.</strong></p>\n\tA Law Student's Toolkit\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f457d0a89aff80028ab7e7b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Yale online courses 8\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">CQF Avocat/Pexels</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&#38;mid=40328&#38;murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.coursera.org%2Flearn%2Flaw-student\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Free to audit, $49 for full access</a></h3><p>Good for both aspiring law students in search of an advantage and advanced law students looking for a refresher, this class goes over foundational topics like terminology, concepts, and tools that lawyers and legal academics use to make their arguments.&#160;</p><p>This course should take approximately 21 hours to complete.</p><p><strong>Note: This course is included in <a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&#38;mid=40328&#38;murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.coursera.org%2Fcourseraplus&#38;u1=1598886147867amcthp3ln|xid:fr1598886152642abf\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Coursera Plus</a>. It's also eligible for financial aid.</strong></p>\n\tMoralities of Everyday Life\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f457b2e42f43f001ddff017?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Yale online courses 9\" height=\"1500\" width=\"2248\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Kat Jayne/Pexels</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&#38;mid=40328&#38;murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.coursera.org%2Flearn%2Fmoralities\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Free to audit, $49 for full access</a></h3><p>This course delves into the psychological foundations of our moral lives. Topics include compassion, the origins of morality, how different cultures influence moral thought and action, and more. The class will end trying to answer how we can be said to be moral agents when studies show how our moral behavior is powerfully influenced by the situations we find ourselves in.&#160;</p><p>This course should take approximately 25 hours to complete.</p><p><strong>Note: This course is included in <a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&#38;mid=40328&#38;murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.coursera.org%2Fcourseraplus&#38;u1=1598886147867amcthp3ln|xid:fr1598886152642abf\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Coursera Plus</a>. It's also eligible for financial aid.</strong></p>\n\tEssentials of Global Health\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f457ba242f43f001ddff01d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"medical coronavirus virus flu sick cold hygiene hand sanitizer clorox hands wash cox 4\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2222\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Crystal Cox/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&#38;mid=40328&#38;murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.coursera.org%2Flearn%2Fessentials-global-health\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Free to audit, $49 for full access</a></h3><p>The Essentials of Global Health is designed to be a comprehensive introduction to global health. The class has a particular emphasis on low- and middle-income countries, the health of the poor, health disparities, and how health matters in the context of global interdependence.&#160;</p><p>Much of the course will focus on investigating five key questions. What do people get sick, disabled, and die from? Why do they suffer from these conditions? Which people are most affected? Why should we care about such concerns? What can be done to address key health issues, hopefully at least cost, as fast as possible, and in sustainable ways?&#160;&#160;</p><p>This course should take approximately 56 hours to complete.</p><p><strong>Note: Unlimited access to this course is available for free for a limited time </strong><a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&#38;mid=40328&#38;murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.coursera.org%2Fpromo%2Ffree-courses-college-students\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\"><strong>to college students</strong></a><strong>. It's also included in <a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&#38;mid=40328&#38;murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.coursera.org%2Fcourseraplus&#38;u1=1598886147867amcthp3ln|xid:fr1598886152642abf\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Coursera Plus</a>, and it's eligible for financial aid.</strong></p>\n\tIntroduction to Climate Change and Health\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f457b3489aff80028ab7e6a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Yale online courses 11\" height=\"1500\" width=\"2250\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Markus Spiske/Pexels</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&#38;mid=40328&#38;murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.coursera.org%2Flearn%2Fintroduction-climate-change-health\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Free seven-day trial, $49 for full access</a></h3><p>This course was designed to get critical information on climate change into the hands of people who can take concrete steps to address its threat, including health and environmental professionals, changemakers, and the general public.&#160;</p><p>Robert Dubrow, Yale professor of epidemiology, covers the science of climate change with an emphasis on health equity. Students will learn how climate change affects human health, its adverse health effects (including those related to extreme heat, waterborne infections, and insect-borne diseases among others), and how measures to reduce greenhouse gas emissions can both limit future climate change and provide immediate health \"co-benefits\".</p><p>This course should take approximately 16 hours to complete.</p><p><strong>Note: This course is eligible for financial aid.&#160;</strong></p>\n\tFAQ:\n\t\n\t<p>Access to lectures and assignments depends on your type of enrollment. If you take a course in Audit Mode, you will be able to see most course material for free. To access graded assignments and to earn a certificate, you will need to purchase the Certificate Experience, either during or after your audit.</p><p>If you don't see the audit option:</p><ul><li>The course may not offer an audit option. You can try a free trial instead, or apply for financial aid.</li><li>The course may offer a 'Full Course, No Certificate' option instead. This alternative lets you see all course materials, submit required assignments, and get a final grade. This also means that you will not be able to purchase a Certificate Experience.</li></ul><h3><a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&#38;mid=40328&#38;murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.coursera.org%2Fyale&#38;u1=1597269754472a2j3nub99%7Cxid:fr1597269758363beh\" target=\"_blank\" ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn51@2020_3/2020/08/31/17-22-14-421_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=8jKQX7WxcMY:YspCUPr-3_Y:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn99@2020_4/2020/08/31/17-22-20-598_4422d7b9ed219283.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=8jKQX7WxcMY:YspCUPr-3_Y:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn27@2020_1/2020/08/31/17-21-57-268_62365cc8bea8f77d.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn76@2020_1/2020/08/31/17-22-07-798_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=8jKQX7WxcMY:YspCUPr-3_Y:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn20@2020_1/2020/08/31/17-22-13-888_0bd12fb6895b38cd.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/8jKQX7WxcMY":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn48@2020_3/2020/08/31/17-22-10-045_ac581edf71a44ab4.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598894512914},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 01:21:52","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 01:21:52","title":"10 ways to optimize your home office and the biggest mistakes to avoid, according to an interior designer","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/10-ways-to-optimize-home-office-biggest-mistakes-to-avoid-2020-8","description":"<p><strong><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f46d583db1ed0002971420a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Home office\" height=\"800\" width=\"1066\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Don&#39;t just buy the first or cheapest thing that comes up.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.shutterstock.com/image-photo/stylish-workplace-computer-home-415899208\" target=\"_blank\">Africa Studio / Shutterstock</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></strong></p><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li><strong>Amie T. Keener</strong> is a registered interior designer and associate at Gensler.</li><li>Many people may have set up their home offices not expecting to be there for the long haul, but it's becoming increasingly clear we may be home for several more months.</li><li>Now you may be scrambling to create a better home office.</li><li>But before you do so, pay attention to these possible pitfalls, especially when ordering furniture online.</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li></ul><p>Like many others, I initially thought we would be working from home just a couple of weeks.</p><p>I set up a bar height bistro table in the corner of the living room as my desk space. But, as the weeks passed, I moved my desk to the other side of the room to face out the window to take in nature, and occasionally, I'll see a hummingbird quickly dashing around the yard.&#160;&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f46d4c5cd2fec00296a46b3?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amie Keener\" height=\"508\" width=\"508\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Amie Keener.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Courtesy of Amie Keener</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>If you're looking &#8212; or needing &#8212; to improve your home office with some new furniture and accessories, it may be quick, easy, and inexpensive to order something online. Yes, there are many great resources out there. But a word of caution: look out for the following common pitfalls.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</p><h2><strong>Cost</strong></h2><p>Do you have a budget? Establish one up front. Include items like desks, chair, task light, ergonomic tools. Likely items are bookcase, file cabinet, and maybe rug or flooring material. Also consider accessories such as artwork and plants as they can enhance overall well-being in the space.&#160;&#160;&#160;</p><h2><strong>Size&#160;</strong></h2><p>Grab a tape measure and test out what new furniture will look like in the space.&#160; Consider taping it out on the floor with masking tape or cutting out newspaper or a cardboard box the size you are considering.&#160;&#160;</p><h2><strong>Ergonomic factors</strong></h2><p>We are all spending more time in our home offices. Comfort is important, and good ergonomic solutions are even more essential. Do you need a desk and task chair? Or would you benefit from soft seating, like a lounge chair or sofa for some of your work?</p><p>Do you like to stand up and work? Maybe a bar height table and stools make more sense for you.&#160;</p><h2><strong>Location</strong>&#160;</h2><p>Does your home office space have enough light? Will you be on video calls? Natural light can always improve how we look over video. Seek out light sources from a variety of angles. Avoid all down lighting. You want to make sure to provide the best representation of yourself on video.</p><p>Consider the animals in your home: Do they find your workspace cozy too? I'm allergic to cats, but I get a kick out of seeing my co-worker's furry friends jump into the view of the camera. Having an animal join our calls has been a nice treat on occasion.</p><p>Take intp account the noise near your home office workspace; if you are on a morning conference call, will the sound of your toddler in the background alarm your coworkers?</p><p>Consider the temperature of your office space: Is it hot, will you need to add a fan or something to circulate the air? Will the noise of the fan get picked up on conference calls and sound like a jet?&#160;&#160;</p><h2><strong>Connectivity</strong></h2><p>Do you need power/data cords? I miss my motorized sit-to-stand desk at the office. Consider cord lengths and distance from wall outlets. Will you need to connect to printer, screen, speakers, camera, etc.? You don't want to create deathly tripping hazards or risks of overloading electrical outlets/circuits.</p><p>I found my internet speed improved by connecting an ethernet cable directly into the router. If you can place your workspace as close to the router you may minimize future technology headaches.&#160;&#160;&#160;</p><h2><strong>Product</strong></h2><p>Where is the product coming from? What is involved with shipping and handling?&#160; Most office furniture today is blended with parts from around the globe. Does the company have customer support here in the US?&#160;&#160;</p><h2><strong>Freight</strong>&#160;</h2><p>Is the product insured as it goes from the factory to your home? What if there's freight damage? It's rare, but something to consider, with unknown shipping sources.</p><p>Stick to a reliable company that provides insurance, like the US Postal Service, UPS, FedEx, etc. How much time will it take you to chase down the right part?&#160;&#160;</p><h2><strong>Assembly</strong></h2><p>Does it require you putting it together? Do you have the right skill set, tools and patience to assemble the new furniture?&#160; If not, it's critical to find someone who can help in an affordable and efficient manner.</p><h2><strong>Warranty</strong></h2><p>What happens if your new furniture is all set up and a few weeks pass, and something breaks? Read the fine print; what is the warranty on the product you are purchasing?&#160;&#160;&#160;</p><h2><strong>Care and maintenance</strong></h2><p>You want your furniture to last and be germ free as much as possible. Wood is always a nice feature for desks, but are you willing to take care and responsibility for it?</p><p>Are you like me, who often eats lunch at my desk? Maybe plastic laminate or metal surfaces are more logical for your space.&#160; &#160;</p><p>I suspect we will be working from home in some form or fashion in the coming months, so it's important to have a well thought out home office furniture solution. We love our families and roommates, but it's beneficial to have a quiet place to break away in your home.</p><p>Also, you may find yourself using your home office workspace for other uses (paying bills, making out grocery lists, meal planning, writing letters, etc.). Flexible and adaptable solutions are valuable in more ways in one.</p><p><strong><em>Amie T. Keener</em></strong><em>, RID, IIDA, LEED AP, CDT is a registered Interior Designer and Associate at Gensler. With more than 20 years of experience in the commercial building industry, Amie's professional career is a robust blend of commercial interiors projects for energy, automotive, financial services, technology, and professional services firms. Currently, her focus is on furniture services, where she helps develop and implement furniture standards for clients.</em></p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/10-ways-to-optimize-home-office-biggest-mistakes-to-avoid-2020-8'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=4F2DEt9U-gw:x6dUPfh3kBA:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=4F2DEt9U-gw:x6dUPfh3kBA:F7zBnMyn0Lo\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=4F2DEt9U-gw:x6dUPfh3kBA:F7zBnMyn0Lo\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=4F2DEt9U-gw:x6dUPfh3kBA:V_sGLiPBpWU\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=4F2DEt9U-gw:x6dUPfh3kBA:V_sGLiPBpWU\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=4F2DEt9U-gw:x6dUPfh3kBA:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=4F2DEt9U-gw:x6dUPfh3kBA:gIN9vFwOqvQ\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=4F2DEt9U-gw:x6dUPfh3kBA:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/4F2DEt9U-gw\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 31 Aug 2020 13:07:00 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f46d583db1ed0002971420a?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"e8e851f0fec04326101152484eed598c","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn76@2020_3/2020/08/31/17-21-53-502_7c32fe3e5c9b71d6.webp","destWidth":1066,"destHeight":800,"sourceBytes":37728,"destBytes":37728,"author":"insider@insider.com (Amie T. Jackson/Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul><li><strong>US stocks fluctuated on Monday as traders weighed the economic recovery against climbing COVID-19 cases and lingering US-China tensions.</strong></li><li><strong>The benchmark S&#38;P 500 remained on pace for its best August since 1984.</strong></li><li><strong>Still, coronavirus cases continue to climb in the US. And tensions between the US and China are elevated over the potential sale of TikTok.</strong></li><li><strong>Both <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/aapl-stock?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestgest\">Apple</a> and <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/tsla-stock\">Tesla</a> gained after undergoing stock splits.</strong></li><li><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Read more on Business Insider</a>.</strong></li></ul><hr ><p>US stocks traded mixed on Monday as traders weighed the economic recovery against climbing COVID-19 cases and lingering US-China tensions. The <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/index/s&p_500_500\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">S&#38;P 500</a> remained on pace for its best August since 1984.</p><p>Both the S&#38;P 500 and the Nasdaq composite <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/stock-market-news-today-sp500-nasdaq-records-economic-data-recovery-2020-8-1029545194#\">notched multiple record highs</a> last week amid encouraging consumer-spending data and a <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/federal-reserve-inflation-jerome-powell-jackson-hole-comments-crisis-strategy-2020-8-1029540793?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestgest\">shift in monetary policy from the Federal Reserve</a> that is likely to keep interest rates low for some time.</p><p>\"Jerome Powell's soothing tones are continuing to provide that calming reassurance for investors, even as we head into what could be a rollercoaster ride in the final months of the year,\" Craig Erlam, a senior market analyst at Oanda Europe, said in a Monday note. \"Investors as ever are optimistic.\"</p><p><strong>Here's where US indexes stood at 11:50 a.m. ET on Monday:</strong></p><ul><li><strong><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/index/s&p_500?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestm=ingest\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">S&#38;P 500</a>:</strong> 3,504.66, down 0.1%</li><li><strong><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/index/dow_jones?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestgest\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Dow Jones industrial average</a>:</strong> 28,436.61, down 0.4% (217 points)</li><li><strong><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/index/nasdaq_composite?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestgest\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Nasdaq composite</a>:</strong> 11,760.22, up 0.5%</li></ul><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong> <a continue crushing the market as the 'shared favorites' of Wall Street's biggest investors</a></em></p><p>Two major stock splits took effect on Monday. Shares of <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/aapl-stock?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestgest\">Apple</a> rose after a 4-for-1 stock split, and <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/tsla-stock\">Tesla</a> climbed after its 5-for-1 split.</p><p>Abroad, Nikkei 225 stocks rose in Japan, boosted after Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway said on Sunday &#8212; <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/warren-buffett-90th-birthday-stories-sees-candies-geico-berkshire-hathaway-2020-8-1029545669?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestgest\">Buffett's 90th birthday</a> &#8212; that it bought stakes in <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/warren-buffett-reveals-6-billion-investment-5-japanese-companies-2020-8-1029546397\">five of the country's largest trading companies</a>.</p><p>Despite major indexes sitting near record highs, investors are still looking for signs of progress toward further economic stimulus. Congress is set to return from its recess in September and could restart talks on details of the next stimulus package, over which Democrats and Republicans were deadlocked.</p><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/stock-market-crash-david-rosenberg-dot-com-tech-bubble-distortions-2020-8\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">35-year market vet David Rosenberg warns the stock market's rally features distortions that were glaring during the tech bubble &#8212; and lays out his plausible scenario for a crash</a></em></p><p>Meanwhile, coronavirus cases continue to climb in the US, hanging over markets. Tensions between the US and China also remain high. On Friday, <a href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-08-31/china-throws-a-wrench-into-trump-s-plan-to-force-tiktok-sale?sref=Zwwm81xn\">Beijing claimed it could block a sale of TikTok</a> to buyers such as <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/msft-stock\">Microsoft</a>, <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/wmt-stock\">Walmart</a>, or <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/orcl-stock\">Oracle</a>.</p><p><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/commodities/oil-price?type=wti\">West Texas Intermediate crude</a> gained as much as 1.4%, to $43.57 per barrel. <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/commodities/oil-price\">Brent crude</a>, the international benchmark, rose 3.3%, to $46.53, at intraday highs.</p><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/stock-picks-to-buy-cheap-companies-strong-earnings-morgan-stanley-2020-8\" target=\"_blank\" 2020 15:50:00 01:21:52","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 01:21:52","title":"The best smart wallets","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-smart-wallet","description":"<ul class=\"summary-list\"><li><strong>When you need to carry cash, credit cards, and ID a wallet is one of the best ways to do it, but the risk of theft or loss looms large, so consider a smart wallet with features like location tracking and RFID protection.&#160;</strong></li><li><strong>The best smart wallet for most people is the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07PWKM24K/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=biipgf_073120_best-smart-wallets-20&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B07PWKM24K&linkId=806c9b6a72ee709458d473d4e74dc55c72ee709458d473d4e74dc55c\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Ekster Parliament</a> in our opinion, but we have several excellent alternatives listed here.</strong></li><li><strong>If you're content with a plain old regular wallet, then read our guide to the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-wallet-men?r=US&IR=TIR=T\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">best men's wallets</a>.</strong></li></ul><p>Even with mobile payments taking off, most of us still carry credit cards, ID, membership cards, and sometimes even cash around with us. The best way to keep all those things together is to use a wallet. The humble folded leather wallet for cards and cash has seen something of a reinvention of late, with a new wave of smart wallets hitting the market.</p><p>You may be wondering why you need your wallet to be smart. Well, what happens when your wallet goes missing? Many smart wallets offer tracking capabilities, so you can get a warning if you leave it behind and track its location on a map on your phone. Another common feature is protection from RFID skimming to prevent criminals from stealing card information.&#160;</p><p>New smart wallet designs also allow for quick card removal, special compartments, and other extras. I've been testing out various smart wallets, reading up on reviews and user impressions, and compiling a list that includes a smart wallet to suit anyone. These are the best smart wallets, from the feature-packed to the minimalist, with a few that fall somewhere in between.&#160;</p><p>Before we get started, it's worth noting that you can always buy a tracker, like the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tile-slim-tracker-review-2018-6\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Tile Slim</a> or Chipolo Card, and slip it into any of the wallets listed here that lack built-in tracking, any of our picks of the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-wallet-men?r=US&IR=TIR=T\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">best men's wallets</a>, or any other wallet you like.</p><h2>Here are the best smart wallets:</h2><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li><strong>Best smart wallet overall: <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07PWKM24K/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=biipgf_073120_best-smart-wallets-20&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B07PWKM24K&linkId=806c9b6a72ee709458d473d4e74dc55c72ee709458d473d4e74dc55c\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Ekster Parliament</a><br ></strong></li><li><strong>Best minimalist smart wallet: <a href=\"https://noduscollection.com/collections/wallets/products/compact-card?variant=7980110086199\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Nodus Compact Card</a><br ></strong></li><li><strong>Best slim smart wallet with tracking: <a href=\"https://www.pntra.com/t/TUJGRUVORUJGSEhLR01CRkZOSE1L?url=https%3A%2F%2Fnomadgoods.com%2Fproducts%2Fslim-wallet-tile\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Nomad Slim Wallet Tile Tracking Edition</a><br ></strong></li><li><strong>Best modular smart wallet: <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07BSDR9T4/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=biipgf_073120_best-smart-wallets-20&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B07BSDR9T4&linkId=7720bc1c1d7c557d226d5e056eefeecb1d7c557d226d5e056eefeecb\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Pitaka MagEZ Wallet</a><br ></strong></li><li><strong>Best smart wallet for travel: <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07DZN93JB/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=biipgf_073120_best-smart-wallets-20&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B07DZN93JB&linkId=0caf532ac29f580479c54799fb95c610c29f580479c54799fb95c610\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Bellroy Travel Wallet</a></strong></li></ul>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tThe best smart wallet overall\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f2442362618b959e27a1152?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Ekster_Parliament_Smart_Wallet\" height=\"3024\" width=\"4032\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Simon Hill/INSIDER</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07PWKM24K/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_073120_best-smart-wallets-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B07PWKM24K&#38;linkId=806c9b6a72ee709458d473d4e74dc55c\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">The innovative Ekster Parliament</a> combines quick access to cards, location tracking capability, and RFID blocking in a stylish leather finish.&#160;</h3><p><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07PWKM24K/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_073120_best-smart-wallets-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B07PWKM24K&#38;linkId=806c9b6a72ee709458d473d4e74dc55c\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">This compact smart wallet</a> has a distinctive look and all the features that most people are likely to want. The premium leather exterior comes in a choice of seven different colors. The first thing you'll likely notice is the trigger mechanism, which pops up the cards in the aluminum cardholder and fans them for quick and easy access to the one you need.</p><p>Open the wallet and you'll find two card slots in the cover and an elastic strap for holding notes. The aluminum cardholder has room for four or five cards, blocks RFID signals, and ensures that your cards never get bent. On the back there's an external pocket which is where you'll keep the optional Chipolo tracking card, specially made in partnership with Ekster and bearing the classy Ekster logo.&#160;</p><p>This tracking card plugs into Chipolo's network of tracking devices, has a range of 200 feet, and works via the Chipolo app for Android or iOS. It's quick and easy to set up an account. The mobile app allows you to ping the tracker card, so it plays a sound to help you find your wallet in a hurry. You can also press the button on the tracker card to ring your phone if you've misplaced it.&#160;</p><p>Chipolo is a popular tracking service, so it has worldwide coverage. If you can't find your wallet at the last known location on the map, you can mark it as lost, and there's a chance that another Chipolo user could turn up the location. You can also set out of range alerts, so your phone will ping if you leave your wallet behind. There's even support for Google Assistant and Amazon Alexa, so you can ask either voice assistant where your wallet is and have it ring or tell you the last known location.</p><p>Of all the smart wallets I've tested, this is the one I keep coming back to. The tracking via Chipolo is handy, as it's a service I already use with my keys, so I can track both items from the same app. The out of range alert has saved me from leaving my wallet in a friend's couch and on a caf&#233; table. I also love the look of <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07PWKM24K/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_073120_best-smart-wallets-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B07PWKM24K&#38;linkId=806c9b6a72ee709458d473d4e74dc55c\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">this wallet</a>, but the trigger that pops the cards up is probably my most appreciated feature. No more fumbling to pull a card out of your wallet at the bar or checkout, pull the trigger and there it is.&#160;</p><p>On the downside, there isn't a lot of room for cash here. I find a single note or two will sit happily behind the strap, but if you have a lot of cash it pushes the cover open and this is already quite a thick wallet. You also have to charge the tracker from time to time. The battery life is around two to three months, depending on how often you use the location features. There's a tiny solar panel on the tracker, so if you remember to occasionally leave it in the sun it stays topped up, but this does require you to remove it from the wallet occasionally.</p><p><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07PWKM24K/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_073120_best-smart-wallets-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B07PWKM24K&#38;linkId=806c9b6a72ee709458d473d4e74dc55c\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">The Ekster Parliament wallet</a> costs $89.00 and you can add the tracker card for $29.00, making it $118 in total. That may sound pricey for a wallet, but as the best smart wallet you can get, it's worth it. Ekster offers free returns and a one-year warranty.</p><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Premium leather, quick card access, tracking via Chipolo, RFID protection, strap for cash, compact</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>Tracker needs to be charged, quite thick</p>\n\tThe best minimalist smart wallet\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f24427a7924a1280434fb65?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Nodus_Compact_Card_Wallet\" height=\"3024\" width=\"4032\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Simon Hill/INSIDER</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>When you want to travel light, <a href=\"https://noduscollection.com/collections/wallets/products/compact-card?variant=7980110086199\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">the Nodus Compact Card wallet</a> is the perfect companion.&#160;</h3><p>For everyday use, most of us don't need a big fat wallet. If you prefer something slim and minimal, <a href=\"https://noduscollection.com/collections/wallets/products/compact-card?variant=7980110086199\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">the Nodus Compact Card</a> is perfect. The finish is full grain vegetable tanned Italian leather and it comes in four colors. The stylish octopus Nodus logo completes a classy look.</p><p>There's a slot for a card or two on each side, with an internal pocket for cash, which also has a key holder notch for a single key. You can fit everything you need for a night out in <a href=\"https://noduscollection.com/collections/wallets/products/compact-card?variant=7980110086199\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">this compact wallet</a>. It measures just 3.8 inches by 2.5 inches, so it slips easily into any pocket, even if you're wearing skinny jeans.</p><p>One side of the wallet is RFID shielded to protect your cards and the other is RFID enabled, so you can pay at contactless terminals without having to take your card out of the wallet at all. Just make sure the shielded side is facing out when you slip this wallet into your pocket, and you're safe from RFID skimming.</p><p>Tracking is not part of the package, but you could easily add a Tile Slim or a Chipolo Card into the central pocket if you wanted to.&#160;</p><p><a href=\"https://noduscollection.com/collections/wallets/products/compact-card?variant=7980110086199\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The Compact Card Wallet</a> is quite expensive at $55. If you like the look of this, but feel you need a bit more room, then check out the Nodus Compact Wallet, as it adds room for more cards and cash. Nodus wallets finally come with a two-year warranty.</p><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Premium leather, slim, minimalist, RFID shielding, key pocket</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>Limited space, no built-in tracking</p>\n\tThe best slim smart wallet with tracking\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f2443347924a12861014429?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Nomad_Slim_Wallet_with_Tile_Tracking\" height=\"3024\" width=\"4032\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Simon Hill/INSIDER</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>A stylish, traditional-looking, leather, folding wallet, <a href=\"https://www.pntra.com/t/TUJGRUVORUJGSEhLR01CRkZOSE1L?url=https%3A%2F%2Fnomadgoods.com%2Fproducts%2Fslim-wallet-tile\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">the Nomad Slim Wallet</a> has a hidden pocket with a Tile tracker inside and space for lots of cards.&#160;</h3><p>Fans of the traditional folding leather look will love <a href=\"https://www.pntra.com/t/TUJGRUVORUJGSEhLR01CRkZOSE1L?url=https%3A%2F%2Fnomadgoods.com%2Fproducts%2Fslim-wallet-tile\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">this smart wallet from Nomad</a>. It's finished in beautiful brown or black leather from Chicago-based tannery, Horween, which dates to 1905. That quality leather is combined with smart tracking via the Tile Slim, which is included in a hidden pocket.</p><p>This looks like a classic bifold wallet and has a single exterior pocket on the back. Open it up and you'll find the Nomad and Horween brands embossed in the cover along with four card slots. The other side offers space for another card and maybe a folded bill or two. On closer inspection, there's an elastic liner that can be peeled back to reveal a Tile Slim tracking device inside.</p><p>A concealed, stealth pocket is cool, and could conceivably pull double duty for other contents, but it's a particularly smart move for a tracker, because you don't want thieves to notice and discard it.&#160;</p><p>You'll need the Tile app for Android or iOS to pair with <a href=\"https://www.pntra.com/t/TUJGRUVORUJGSEhLR01CRkZOSE1L?url=https%3A%2F%2Fnomadgoods.com%2Fproducts%2Fslim-wallet-tile\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">your Tile Slim</a>, but it's very easy to set up. This is the older model of the Tile Slim tracker, which has a 100-foot range and 1-year battery life. There's a button on the center of <a href=\"https://www.pntra.com/t/TUJGRUVORUJGSEhLR01CRkZOSE1L?url=https%3A%2F%2Fnomadgoods.com%2Fproducts%2Fslim-wallet-tile\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">the Tile Slim</a> that you can double press through the wallet to ring your phone. You can also use the app to ring <a href=\"https://www.pntra.com/t/TUJGRUVORUJGSEhLR01CRkZOSE1L?url=https%3A%2F%2Fnomadgoods.com%2Fproducts%2Fslim-wallet-tile\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">the Tile Slim</a> and find your wallet, and it has a kind of proximity sensor with concentric circles to give you a visual of how close you are.</p><p>The Tile app also shows you the last known location on a map. If you're prepared to pay for a Tile Premium subscription, which is $2.99 per month or $29.99 for the year, you can get geofencing alerts to warn you when you leave your wallet behind somewhere and 30-day location history. Sadly, this Tile Slim model doesn't have a replaceable battery, but you should get a discounted price on a new tracker when your battery runs out through the reTile program. Tile also supports both Google Assistant and Amazon Alexa, so you can have your wallet or phone ring using Tile with either voice assistant.&#160;</p><p>This is a gorgeous wallet with enough room to satisfy most people, and I really appreciate the stealth pocket. It looks and feels just like a traditional leather wallet, which is ideal if you'd rather not draw attention and you want to boost your chances of the tracker inside going unnoticed by a thief.</p><p>All that's missing here, in the way of common smart wallet features, is RFID shielding. <a href=\"https://www.pntra.com/t/TUJGRUVORUJGSEhLR01CRkZOSE1L?url=https%3A%2F%2Fnomadgoods.com%2Fproducts%2Fslim-wallet-tile\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">The Nomad Slim Wallet</a> with Tile Tracking is fairly expensive at $79.95, but that includes the Tile Slim tracker. You could also buy just the wallet for $59.95 and add a Chipolo or another tracker instead. Nomad wallets come with a two-year warranty.&#160;</p><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Premium leather, slim design, plenty of space, hidden pocket, Tile Slim tracker included, reasonable price</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>No RFID shielding, some Tile features require subscription, can't recharge Tile Slim</p>\n\tThe best modular smart wallet\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f244384aee6a82f687a94b2?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Pitaka_MagEZ_Wallet\" height=\"3024\" width=\"4032\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Simon Hill/INSIDER</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>Finished in futuristic carbon fiber with a magnetic modular design, <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07BSDR9T4/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_073120_best-smart-wallets-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B07BSDR9T4&#38;linkId=7720bc1c1d7c557d226d5e056eefeecb\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">the Pitaka MagEZ wallet</a> is truly unique.</h3><p>If you want your smart wallet to make a statement, then <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07BSDR9T4/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_073120_best-smart-wallets-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B07BSDR9T4&#38;linkId=7720bc1c1d7c557d226d5e056eefeecb\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">the Pitaka MagEZ wallet</a> is certain to catch your eye. This is an incredibly lightweight magnetic carbon wallet that features a modular design, enabling you to add extra layers for cards, a money clip, or a box for keys or maybe a tracker.&#160;</p><p>Finished in genuine carbon fiber, <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07BSDR9T4/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_073120_best-smart-wallets-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B07BSDR9T4&#38;linkId=7720bc1c1d7c557d226d5e056eefeecb\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">this wallet</a> really stands out from the crowd. The first thing you'll notice is that it's very light, weighing in at just 54 grams. The various sections of the wallet are held together with magnets and can slide apart to reveal space to securely store up to six cards. It's quite easy to quickly slide open to the card you need, once you get the hang of it, but it does feel as though the whole wallet is going to come apart at first. You can pull the layers completely apart, as they are only held together by magnets.</p><p>Apart from the worry that you may accidentally drop layers trying to open it, which evaporates once you get used to how this wallet works, the magnets also mean you can't use magnetic swipe cards with this wallet. However, chip and PIN, contactless cards, and IDs are fine. There is also RFID shielding to keep your cards safe from skimming.&#160;</p><p>This is a fun, if slightly strange smart wallet. It is quite boxy, especially if you add extra layers and the hard construction, though very light, isn't the most comfortable thing in your pocket. On the other hand, it ensures that your cards never get bent accidentally.&#160;</p><p>The standard <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07BSDR9T4/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_073120_best-smart-wallets-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B07BSDR9T4&#38;linkId=7720bc1c1d7c557d226d5e056eefeecb\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Pitaka MagEZ wallet</a> comes with space for six cards and costs $80. You can get your name, or some other text engraved on a metal plate on the top layer for an extra $10. Extra layers for cards cost $25 each, the money clip costs $30, and the versatile box layer is $35. It also comes with a limited lifetime warranty.</p><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Carbon fiber finish, magnetic design, modular system, RFID shielding, sleek and lightweight</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>Uncomfortable in pocket, no built-in tracking</p>\n\tThe best smart wallet for travel\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f298823aee6a84d484bdc10?format=jpeg\" alt=\"bellroy travel wallet\" height=\"842\" width=\"1123\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Bellroy</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>The thoughtfully designed <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07DZN93JB/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_073120_best-smart-wallets-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B07DZN93JB&#38;linkId=0caf532ac29f580479c54799fb95c610\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Bellroy Travel Wallet</a> is packing everything you need for a smooth trip.&#160;&#160;</h3><p>Travel is stressful and it requires you to have a lot of things at your fingertips. Fumbling to find your passport, local cash, or SIM card to switch in when you touch down is never fun, but <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07DZN93JB/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_073120_best-smart-wallets-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B07DZN93JB&#38;linkId=0caf532ac29f580479c54799fb95c610\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">the Bellroy Travel Wallet</a> can help. This large wallet holds a passport, cards, cash, and has room for a whole lot more.</p><p>Finished in premium leather, which comes in four colors, the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07DZN93JB/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_073120_best-smart-wallets-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B07DZN93JB&#38;linkId=0caf532ac29f580479c54799fb95c610\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Bellroy Travel Wallet</a> looks like an oversized bifold wallet. It measures 5.9 inches by 3.8 inches. Open it up and you'll see that the extra size is to accommodate a passport pocket. The cover has four card slots and in the middle there's a micro pen that's ideal for filling out customs forms, saving you from having to dig into bags.</p><p>So far, so standard, what elevates <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07DZN93JB/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_073120_best-smart-wallets-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B07DZN93JB&#38;linkId=0caf532ac29f580479c54799fb95c610\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">the Bellroy Travel Wallet</a> is the RFID shielding to protect your cards and passport, and the secret compartment hidden under a fold of the leather at the back of the wallet. This compartment runs the length of the wallet, and it's divided into two, so it's ideal for keeping cash in two currencies. The hidden compartment is also the perfect place for a tracker if you decide to add one.&#160;</p><p>You'll also find three extra card slots and two small pockets specially designed to hold a SIM card and SIM card removal tool. It's often much cheaper to switch SIM cards when you travel for local service, so this is a thoughtful addition.&#160;</p><p><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07DZN93JB/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_073120_best-smart-wallets-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B07DZN93JB&#38;linkId=0caf532ac29f580479c54799fb95c610\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">The Bellroy Travel Wallet</a> is inevitably bigger than your average wallet and so is the price tag, at $119.00, but it's the perfect smart wallet to take on your travels. It comes with a three-year warranty.&#160;</p><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Premium leather, clever design, hidden pocket, RFID protection, micro pen, SIM and SIM tool pockets</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>Large, no built-in tracking</p>\n\tWhat else we considered\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f24670a40c1f3288052e5e5?format=jpeg\" alt=\"men wallet\" height=\"553\" width=\"737\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Volterman</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>There are lots of other smart wallets out there, promising all sorts of extra features like anti-theft cameras, fingerprint sensors, and internal power banks. Sadly, many smart wallets that start life on crowdfunding sites sound great but fail to deliver on their promise.&#160;</p><ul><li><a href=\"https://woolet.company.site/Smart-Wallet-Glow-1-0-p188416922\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"><strong>Woolet Woof Glow ($120):</strong></a> With Bluetooth tracking, alerts when you leave it behind, and an LED light, the Woolet Woof Glow is an interesting smart wallet. It also allows you to remotely control your phone to take selfies, record audio, or tag your car's location. It is leather, has space for cards, cash, and coins, and comes with a charging cable. Sadly, user reviews are mixed, and availability seems to be limited. https://woolet.company.site/Smart-Wallet-Glow-1-0-p188416922</li><li><a href=\"https://www.volterman.com/product/bifold/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"><strong>Volterman Smart Wallet ($238): </strong></a>This smart wallet promised so much, with a built-in power bank, distance alarm, global GPS tracking, anti-theft camera, and even Wi-Fi hotspot functionality, but after a successful Indiegogo campaign it was delayed. When it finally shipped, user reviews complained about how thick it is and reported problems with some of the features not working. We've been unable to get a review unit to try this for ourselves. https://www.volterman.com/product/bifold/</li><li><strong><a href=\"https://www.gocashew.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Cashew Wallet ($100):</a> </strong>A wallet with its own fingerprint sensor that refuses to open without the owner's fingerprint is an interesting idea. The Cashew Wallet also offers Bluetooth tracking, a buzzer to help you find it, and a rechargeable battery. But, this is another Kickstarter product that suffered delays and garnered disappointed user reviews when it finally shipped. https://www.gocashew.com/</li></ul>\n</div><div 01:21:52","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 01:21:52","title":"Billionaire investor Leon Cooperman says stock-market returns will be 'relatively unimpressive for a long time' after the rebound rally","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/stock-market-outlook-leon-cooperman-returns-forecast-unimpressive-long-time-2020-8","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f43e23642f43f001ddfe9f2?format=jpeg\" alt=\"leon cooperman\" height=\"1750\" width=\"3500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.reutersconnect.com/all?id=tag%3Areuters.com%2C2013%3Anewsml_GM1E95A08Y301&#38;share=true\" target=\"_blank\">Rick Wilking/Reuters</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul><li><strong>Billionaire investor Leon Cooperman said on a <a href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/video/2020/08/31/leon-cooperman-stock-market-returns-unimpressive-for-a-long-time.html\">Monday interview with CNBC</a> that he expects stock market returns to slow going forward.&#160;</strong></li><li><strong>\"The overall market, we've been pulling a lot of demand forward. I would expect that future returns will be relatively unimpressive for a long time,\" Cooperman said.&#160;</strong></li><li><strong>He added that the stock market rally, which has been driven by the Federal Reserve's pledge to hold interest rates near zero for a long time, may lose momentum as the coronavirus pandemic recession continues on, hurting the US economy and businesses.</strong></li><li><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/\">Read more on Business Insider.&#160;</a></strong></li></ul><hr ><p>Billionaire investor Leon Cooperman warned in a <a href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/video/2020/08/31/leon-cooperman-stock-market-returns-unimpressive-for-a-long-time.html\">Monday interview with CNBC</a> that stock market returns are likely to be \"unimpressive\" for some time following this year's swift rebound rally.&#160;</p><p>The stock market has recovered from its coronavirus pandemic low in March in record time, reentering a bull market fueled by the Federal Reserve's pledge to keep interest rates low for a long time, according to Cooperman.&#160;</p><p>But he's hesitant about future returns. \"I am uncomfortable at the present time,\" said Cooperman. \"Who pays for the party when the party is over?\"&#160;</p><p>\"The overall market, we've been pulling a lot of demand forward. I would expect that future returns will be relatively unimpressive for a long time,\" Cooperman said.&#160;</p><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/us-investing-championship-strategy-matthew-caruso-contender-secret-to-return-2020-8\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">US Investing Championship hopeful Matthew Caruso landed a 382% return in the first half of 2020. He shares the unique twist he's putting on a classic trading strategy &#8212; and 3 stocks he's holding right now.</a></em></p><p>Cooperman's conservative view hinges on the huge amounts of debt he sees the US adding up. \"We came into 2020 with a full employed economy, yet we were running a trillion-dollar deficit. And now we're piling a lot of debt on top of that,\" said Cooperman.&#160;</p><p>He added that the stock market rally, which has been driven by the Fed, may lose momentum as the coronavirus pandemic recession continues on, hurting the US economy and businesses. He also pointed out that Japan and Europe have had zero or negative interest rates for some time, but their price-earnings ratios are lower than in the US.&#160;</p><p>\"What people have to understand is that the Fed is pursuing this zero-interest rate policy not because things are good in the economy,\" said Cooperman. \"They're pursuing a zero-interest rate policy because things are bad in the economy.\"</p><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/stock-picks-to-buy-hedge-mutual-funds-market-favorites-goldman-2020-8\" target=\"_blank\"
