border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=8TzlUVC91zw:j0Fmzw-7BkA:gIN9vFwOqvQ\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=8TzlUVC91zw:j0Fmzw-7BkA:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/8TzlUVC91zw\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 31 Aug 2020 15:45:00 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f4d1a0d7ffa48002894d22c?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"22974e9e27953a6dc4356e83b6b8fd49","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn39@2020_3/2020/08/31/17-21-55-784_39c24b3a3cd318d8.webp","destWidth":4003,"destHeight":3002,"sourceBytes":457970,"destBytes":457970,"author":"insider@insider.com (Jaime Toplin)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f4d19bc60bf1f0028079774?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn76@2020_5/2020/08/31/17-22-14-745_2000d5a5f1b146f0.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn51@2020_3/2020/08/31/17-22-14-421_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=8TzlUVC91zw:j0Fmzw-7BkA:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn19@2020_5/2020/08/31/17-22-12-564_6f05bab60b173e70.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=8TzlUVC91zw:j0Fmzw-7BkA:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn11@2020_3/2020/08/31/17-22-18-530_2516a424f84e3d84.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn76@2020_1/2020/08/31/17-22-07-798_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=8TzlUVC91zw:j0Fmzw-7BkA:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn80@2020_5/2020/08/31/17-22-07-963_b27a34afcd7490df.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/8TzlUVC91zw":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn36@2020_6/2020/08/31/17-22-21-570_1c65054216d696b3.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598894512829},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 01:21:52","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 01:21:52","title":"Most of tech's most powerful CEOs are coupled up. Here's what life is like for the husbands and wives of Silicon Valley's elite.","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/tech-ceos-wives-husbands-marriages-lives-bios-2020-1","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f40198642f43f001ddfe6a4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"evan spiegel miranda kerr\" height=\"1790\" width=\"2387\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Snap CEO Evan Spiegel and his wife, Miranda Kerr.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Stefanie Keenan/Getty Images for LACMA</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>Most of tech's most powerful CEOs are married.&#160;</li><li>Not everyone is coupled up &#8212; Elon Musk and Jeff Bezos have girlfriends, while Jack Dorsey and Tim Cook appear to be single.&#160;</li><li>But for those who are married, many of them have been with their spouses for years or even decades.&#160;</li><li>Top executives at companies like Google, Facebook, IBM, Alibaba, and Microsoft are all married &#8212; some of them for decades.&#160;</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories.</a></li></ul><p>It takes a special type of person to become the partner of a high-powered tech executive: From long weeks at work to intense stress, the spouses of CEOs have probably seen it all.&#160;</p><p>Like most other industries, many of the top executives in tech are partnered up. Not all of them are married &#8212; Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey and Apple CEO Tim Cook appear to be single<a href=\"https://pagesix.com/2019/08/19/twitter-ceo-jack-dorsey-selling-mansion-he-bought-for-girlfriend/\">,</a> Tesla CEO Elon Musk has an <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/who-is-grimes-claire-boucher-singer-producer-dating-elon-musk-met-gala-2018-5\">on again, off again relationship</a> with singer Grimes, and Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos is recently divorced and <a href=\"https://www.thecut.com/2019/12/jeff-bezos-st-barths-lauren-sanchez.html\">back in the dating game</a>.&#160;</p><p>But top executives at companies like Google, Facebook, IBM, Alibaba, and Microsoft are all married &#8212; some of them for decades.&#160;</p><p>Here's a look at the lives of the spouses of some of tech's richest and most successful executives.&#160;</p>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tPriscilla Chan\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e0e628d855cc2230c49aaa9?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Mark Zuckerberg Priscilla Chan\" height=\"1786\" width=\"2381\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Priscilla Chan and Mark Zuckerberg.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Taylor Hill/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><strong>Partner:</strong> Mark Zuckerberg, founder and CEO of Facebook</p><p><strong>Years married:</strong> Eight</p><p><strong>Who she is:</strong> Priscilla Chan is a pediatrician and <a href=\"https://chanzuckerberg.com/about/leaders/\">co-CEO of the Chan Zuckerberg Initiative</a>. Chan graduated from Harvard University with a degree in biology and attended the University of California, San Francisco, for medical school. She worked at San Francisco General Hospital as a pediatrician after finishing her residency in 2015, but has since left to <a href=\"https://qz.com/1402697/the-amazing-ascent-of-priscilla-chan/\">manage the daily operations of CZI</a>. Chan is also&#160;<a href=\"https://www.theprimaryschool.org/about-us\">cofounder of The Primary School</a>, a private school that offers free healthcare and education to low-income children in the Palo Alto area.&#160;</p><p>Chan and Zuckerberg <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/mark-zuckerberg-and-priscilla-chans-12-year-relationship-in-photos-2015-7\">met in line for the bathroom at a Harvard frat party</a> in 2003 and married in 2012, right around the time Chan graduated from medical school and Facebook went public. The couple has two daughters together, Max and August.&#160;</p>\n\tLaurene Powell Jobs\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e0a5ae1855cc279e0253cd6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"laurene powell jobs\" height=\"1159\" width=\"1545\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Laurene Powell Jobs.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Michael Cohen/Getty Images for The New York Times</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><strong>Partner:</strong> Steve Jobs, former CEO of Apple</p><p><strong>Years married:</strong> 20, until Jobs' death in 2011</p><p><strong>Who she is:</strong> Laurene Powell Jobs is a philanthropist and the founder of <a href=\"https://www.emersoncollective.com/about-us/\">Emerson Collective</a>, an organization focused on social change. Powell Jobs attended University of Pennsylvania, majoring in economics and political science, and <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2013/05/17/business/steve-jobss-widow-sets-philanthropy-goals.html?_r=0\">worked at Goldman Sachs</a> before <a href=\"https://news.stanford.edu/news/2012/september/trustee-powell-jobs-090512.html\">getting her MBA at Stanford University</a>.&#160;</p><p>After Steve Jobs' death, Powell Jobs inherited his wealth, mostly in the form of Apple and Disney stock &#8212; today, she is currently worth $24.5 billion, <a href=\"https://www.forbes.com/profile/laurene-powell-jobs/#4ee4b64d704f\">according to Forbes</a>. Powell Jobs is an active philanthropist, with a focus on education and the environment. Through Emerson Collective, she has funded news organizations like ProPublica, acquired media properties like Pop-Up Magazine and The Atlantic, of which she has a majority stake, and invested in Axios and the podcast giant Gimlet Media. She is also an avid contemporary art collector and has a multi-million-dollar yacht called the Venus as well as a <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/laurene-powell-jobs-net-worth-life-career-spending-habits-2018-10\">$16.5 million home in San Francisco</a>. &#160;</p><p>Powell Jobs met Steve Jobs in 1989, when she was seated next to him at an event he'd been invited to speak at on campus. The couple had <a href=\"https://www.vogue.com/article/laurene-powell-jobs-xq-super-school-project\">three children</a> together: Reed, Erin, and Eve.&#160;</p>\n\tDennis Troper\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e0e62f6855cc223540bf215?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Susan Wojcicki husband\" height=\"1503\" width=\"2004\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Susan Wojcicki and Dennis Troper.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Taylor Hill/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><strong>Partner:</strong> Susan Wojcicki, CEO of YouTube</p><p><strong>Years married:</strong> 22</p><p><strong>Who he is:</strong> Dennis Troper is also an executive at Google &#8212; he currently serves as director of product management for Wear OS, the company's smartwatch operating system. He's been at Google <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/dennistroper/\">since 2003</a>. Troper got his bachelor's degree at the University of Texas at Austin and his master's at UC Santa Cruz.&#160;</p><p>Troper and Wojcicki's house in Menlo Park was the birthplace of Google: the couple <a href=\"https://www.sfgate.com/bayarea/article/Bay-Area-s-Wojcicki-family-honored-4415518.php\">rented out their garage</a> and two bedrooms to Sergey Brin and Larry Page when the company was starting out.&#160;</p><p>Troper and Wojcicki now have five kids together.</p>\n\tMiranda Kerr\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e0e1878855cc2595b5221df?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Evan Spiegel Miranda Kerr\" height=\"1604\" width=\"2139\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Miranda Kerr and Evan Spiegel.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Stefanie Keenan/Getty Images for Snap Inc</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><strong>Partner:</strong> Evan Spiegel, founder and CEO of Snap</p><p><strong>Years married:</strong> Three</p><p><strong>Who she is:</strong> Miranda Kerr is an Australian model and the founder and CEO of Kora Organics, a company that makes beauty products using natural ingredients. Kerr began as a runway model before landing a contract with Maybelline and, later, Victoria's Secret and Clinique.&#160;</p><p>Kerr and Spiegel <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/evan-spiegel-miranda-kerr-relationship-story-marriage-baby-2017-11\">met in 2015</a> at a dinner by Louis Vuitton in Los Angeles. The night they met, Harper's Bazaar editor-in-chief Glenda Bailey said to Kerr, \"I bet you two are going to get married.\" The couple tied the knot in a top-secret ceremony in May 2017, and now have two sons together, Hart and Myles. Kerr also has a son, Flynn, from her previous marriage to Orlando Bloom.&#160;</p>\n\tMelinda Gates\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e0e1bdf855cc269ef39eb8a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"bill and melinda gates\" height=\"2862\" width=\"3816\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Bill Gates and Melinda Gates.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><strong>Partner:</strong> Bill Gates, cofounder of Microsoft</p><p><strong>Years married:</strong> 26</p><p><strong>Who she is:</strong> Melinda Gates is an active philanthropist, most recently <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/melinda-gates-pledges-1-billion-gender-equality-priorites-2019-10\">pledging $1 billion</a> toward improving gender equality in the next 10 years. Along with her husband, Melinda founded the Gates Foundation, which if focused primarily on poverty and healthcare worldwide. In 2016, Melinda was <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/life-of-melinda-gates-2016-3#in-november-2016-gates-was-awarded-the-presidential-medal-of-freedom-by-president-obama-the-highest-civilian-award-in-the-us-for-her-work-in-health-and-poverty-in-america-and-abroad-19\">awarded the Presidential Medal of Freedom</a> by President Obama.&#160;</p><p>Gates attended Duke University, earning a bachelor's degree in both economics and computer science, as well as an MBA &#8212; all <a href=\"https://today.duke.edu/2013/02/hondegrees2013\">in five years</a>. Gates was recruited by Microsoft as <a href=\"http://community.seattletimes.nwsource.com/archive/?date=19950604&#38;slug=2124492\">a product manager</a> shortly after the company went public, and she eventually worked her way up through the ranks of the company. Gates had a high-powered role until <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/melinda-gates-shocked-bill-gates-when-she-quit-microsfot-2019-4\">she decided to leave</a> when she got pregnant with their first child.&#160;</p><p>The couple met in 1987 at a company picnic &#8212; when Bill Gates asked her out for a date two weeks from then, she initially turned him down. Eventually, they went on a date and were together for seven years before getting married in 1994 in <a href=\"http://www.people.com/people/archive/article/0,,20103514,00.html\">a reported million-dollar ceremony</a>.</p><p>The couple has three kids: Jennifer, Rory, and Phoebe. They share a home in Medina, Washington, that was last estimated to be <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/crazy-facts-about-bill-gates-house-2016-11\">worth $125 million,</a> a <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/billionaire-bill-gates-net-worth-spending-2018-8\">luxury car collection</a>, and a private plane.&#160;</p>\n\tMark Rometty\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e0e14e9855cc25b2e0bb1d9?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Ginni Rometty Mark Rometty\" height=\"1829\" width=\"2439\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Ginni Rometty and Mark Rometty.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Joshua Roberts/Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><strong>Partner:</strong> Ginni Rometty, former CEO of IBM</p><p><strong>Years married:</strong> 40</p><p><strong>Who he is:</strong> Mark Rometty is famously private, and there's not a lot of information available about the outgoing IBM CEO's husband of four decades. Back in 2011, <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2011/11/05/business/a-ceos-support-system-a-k-a-husband.html\">The New York Times</a> reported that Mark Rometty was a principal investor in the Bam Oil Company, although it's unclear whether he's still with the company.&#160;</p><p>But in 2015, Ginni Rometty did mention Mark in <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/ibm-ceo-ginni-rometty-tells-inspiring-story-about-her-husband-2015-6\">a commencement speech at Northwestern University</a>, her alma mater. In the speech, Rometty described how Mark supported her early in her career and pushed her to take an opportunity when she was second-guessing herself.</p><p>The couple met early on in their careers, when they were training in the General Motors Institute. They split their time between New York and Bonita Springs, Florida, and like to go scuba diving together and see Broadway plays, according to The Times.&#160;</p>\n\tSydney Shapiro\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e0e4b31855cc2078938ae3a?format=jpeg\" alt=\" Dara Khosrowshahi\" height=\"2145\" width=\"2860\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Dara Khosrowshahi and Sydney Shapiro.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Scott Olson/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><strong>Partner:</strong> Dara Khosrowshahi, CEO of Uber</p><p><strong>Years married:</strong> Seven</p><p><strong>Who she is:</strong> Sydney Shapiro is a former preschool teacher. Shapiro and Khosrowshahi met in 2008 when they were set up on a blind date. When Khosrowshahi arrived in a suit and driving a Volvo, Shapiro thought, \"he's going to be this arrogant, egocentric, just ... <em>douche</em>,\" she <a href=\"https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2018/04/09/at-uber-a-new-ceo-shifts-gears?mbid=social_twitter\">told The New Yorker</a>. Khosrowshahi surprised her by being funny and asking her a lot of questions, she said, and the couple got married in 2012 in Las Vegas while Shapiro was <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/amazing-life-of-uber-new-ceo-dara-khosrowshahi-2017-8#in-2012-he-married-sydney-shapiro-the-couple-calls-themselves-sci-fi-geeks-the-wedding-was-held-in-las-vegas-and-she-was-wearing-a-t-shirt-from-heavy-metal-band-slayer-they-have-four-kids-22\">wearing a Slayer t-shirt</a>. They now have twin sons, Hayes and Hugo.&#160;</p>\n\tLucy Southworth\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e0e4a04855cc27fcb5eab98?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Larry Lucy\" height=\"1465\" width=\"1953\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Larry Page and Lucy Southworth.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Steve Jennings/Getty Images for MerchantCantos</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><strong>Partner:</strong> Larry Page, cofounder of Google</p><p><strong>Years married:</strong> 12&#160;</p><p><strong>Who she is:</strong> Lucy Southworth is a former research scientist. She attended University of Pennsylvania and has a master's from Oxford University. She was also a doctoral student at Stanford, <a href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/google-page/google-founder-larry-page-to-marry-idUSN1360879220071114\">according to Reuters</a>.&#160;</p><p>The couple reportedly <a href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/google-page/google-founder-larry-page-to-marry-idUSN1360879220071114\">got married</a> on Richard Branson's Necker Island in 2007 and&#160;has <a href=\"https://edition.cnn.com/2013/04/08/us/larry-page-fast-facts\">two kids</a> together. They <a href=\"http://blog.sfgate.com/ontheblock/2009/03/20/larry-page-to-build-new-eco-friendly-house-in-palo-alto/\">reside in a Palo Alto compound</a> that includes a $7 million home and an \"eco-mansion\" with a rooftop garden and solar panels. Page and Southworth also have a $45 million super-yacht called <a href=\"http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-1346157/Google-founder-Larry-Page-buys-193-foot-yacht-45m-second-hand.html\">\"Senses,\"</a> which has a helipad and a Jacuzzi on its deck.</p>\n\tClara Wu Tsai\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e18d34ef44231121619cd62?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Joseph Tsai Clara Wu Tsai\" height=\"1571\" width=\"2095\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Clara Wu Tsai and Joseph Tsai.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Theo Wargo/Getty Images for Lincoln Center</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><strong>Partner:</strong> Joseph Tsai, cofounder and executive vice chairman of Alibaba</p><p><strong>Years married:</strong> 23&#160;</p><p><strong>Who she is:&#160;</strong>Clara Wu Tsai got her undergraduate degree at Stanford University and an MBA at Harvard Business School before working at both American Express and the Chinese shopping site Taobao.&#160;</p><p>The Tsais <a href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2017-10-27/alibaba-s-tsai-said-to-purchase-nba-s-nets-in-2-3-billion-deal\">bought a 49% stake</a> in the Brooklyn Nets in 2017, and in August 2019, <a href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/08/16/joseph-tsai-to-be-sole-owner-of-brooklyn-nets.html\">purchased the remaining share</a> to become the sole owners. The couple also owns Barclays Center, the arena the team plays in, as well as the WNBA team, the New York Liberty.&#160;</p><p>In October 2018, the Tsais made a significant contribution to Stanford's neurosciences institute, which has since <a href=\"https://news.stanford.edu/2018/10/10/wu-tsai-neurosciences-institute-named-clara-wu-tsai-joe-tsai/\">been renamed</a> the Wu Tsai Neurosciences Institute.</p><p>Wu Tsai is also an activist for criminal justice reform, and in early 2019, <a href=\"https://www.vulture.com/2019/01/jay-z-meek-mill-launch-prison-reform-alliance-pledge-usd50m.html\">launched the Reform Alliance</a> along with Meek Mill, Jay-Z, Robert Kraft, and 76ers co-owner Michael Rubin. The initiative's goal is to reform the probation and parole system.&#160;</p><p>The couple <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/1996/10/06/style/clara-wu-and-joseph-tsai.html\">got married in New York City</a> in 1996 and lived in Hong Kong for 13 years before moving to La Jolla, California. They have <a href=\"https://gostanford.com/sports/womens-lacrosse/roster/alex-tsai/16214\">three children</a>: Alex, Dash, and Jacob.</p>\n\tLynne Benioff\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e0e1638855cc2571e4abb94?format=jpeg\" alt=\"marc benioff lynne benioff\" height=\"2250\" width=\"3000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Marc Benioff and Lynne Benioff.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Alberto E. Rodriguez/Getty Images for J/P HRO</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><strong>Partner:</strong> Marc Benioff, founder and co-CEO of Salesforce</p><p><strong>Years married:</strong> 14</p><p><strong>Who she is:</strong> Lynne Benioff is an active philanthropist, serving on the board of numerous causes, including the&#160;UCSF Benioff Children's Hospitals and the Benioff Ocean Initiative. Lynne and Marc Benioff have also <a href=\"https://givingpledge.org/Pledger.aspx?id=165\">signed the Giving Pledge</a>, which states that they'll give away the majority of their wealth during their lifetime or in their will.&#160;</p><p>The Benioffs own multiple houses, including <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/the-rise-of-salesforce-ceo-marc-benioff-2016-3#the-benioffs-have-several-homes-including-this-5-acre-compound-in-hawaii-42\">a five-acre estate in Hawaii</a> &#8212; Hawaii is also reportedly where the couple got married in <a href=\"https://gawker.com/216819/a-wedding-so-secret-the-singer-was-blind\">a top-secret ceremony in 2006</a>.&#160;</p><p>&#160;</p>\n\tAnu Nadella\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e0fbc7a855cc2370f685bb2?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Satya Nadella\" height=\"2821\" width=\"3762\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Satya Nadella.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Kim Kulish/Corbis via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><strong>Partner:</strong> Satya Nadella, CEO of Microsoft</p><p><strong>Years married:</strong> 27 years</p><p><strong>Who she is:&#160;</strong>Anu and Satya Nadella had a <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/microsoft-ceo-satya-nadella-green-card-2017-9\">complicated &#8212; but romantic &#8212; immigration story</a>: The couple got married in December 1992, when Anu still lived in India. While Satya had a green card, immigration authorities rejected Anu's visa application due to a long wait list. Satya gave up his green card and got an H-1B visa instead in order to make the immigration process work for Anu.</p><p>The couple now has three kids, including <a href=\"https://www.seattlechildrens.org/giving/it-starts-with-yes/why-we-say-yes/anu-nadella/\">a son with special needs</a>. Both Satya and Anu have been open about the challenges of raising their son, Zain, who has cerebral palsy &#8212; as a result, Anu is closely involved with Seattle Children's Hospital, including <a href=\"https://www.seattlechildrens.org/giving/it-starts-with-yes/why-we-say-yes/anu-nadella/\">co-chairing the \"It Starts With Yes\" campaign</a>, an effort to raise $1 billion to improve children's health.&#160;</p>\n\tNicole Systrom\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e0e19a9855cc25ac97e5920?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Kevin Systrom Nicole Systrom\" height=\"2435\" width=\"3247\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Kevin and Nicole Systrom.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Taylor Hill/FilmMagic</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><strong>Partner:</strong> Kevin Systrom, cofounder and former CEO of Instagram</p><p><strong>Years married:</strong> Three</p><p><strong>Who she is:</strong> Nicole Systrom is the founder of <a href=\"http://www.sutroenergygroup.com/\">Sutro Energy Group</a>, which is aimed at funding the clean-energy sector. Systrom has <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/nicoleschuetz/\">spent her career</a> focused on energy and the environment &#8212; she went to Stanford University for both her undergrad and graduate degrees, both of which had an environmental focus.&#160;</p><p>Nicole and Kevin Systrom met at Stanford, years before Kevin would go on to create Instagram &#8212; in fact, Kevin <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/kevin-systrom-instagram-ceo-life-rise-2018-9#soon-after-krieger-joined-the-pair-decided-to-pivot-burbn-eliminating-most-of-the-features-to-focus-solely-on-photo-sharing-but-the-real-a-ha-moment-came-while-systrom-was-on-the-beach-with-his-now-wife-nicole-11\">credits Nicole</a> with coming up with the idea for Instagram filters. The couple got engaged over Thanksgiving in 2013, and married on Halloween in 2016, <a href=\"https://www.vogue.com/article/instagram-kevin-systrom-wedding-nicole-schuetz-napa-valley\">according to Vogue</a>. The couple has a daughter together, Freya.&#160;</p>\n\tAnjali Pichai\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e0e1ee3855cc264a9784fe6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Sundar Pichai and wife Anjali Pichai\" height=\"1769\" width=\"2359\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Anjali Pichai and Sundar Pichai.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Josh Edelson/AFP via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><strong>Partner:</strong> Sundar Pichai, CEO of Google and Alphabet</p><p><strong>Years married:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.ibtimes.com/sundar-pichais-wife-who-anjali-pichai-2577509\">Over 25</a></p><p><strong>Who she is:</strong> Anjali Pichai is a chemical engineer who met Sundar Pichai <a href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2017/oct/07/google-boss-sundar-pichai-tax-gender-equality-data-protection-jemima-kiss\">while in college</a> at the Indian Institute of Technology Kharagpur.&#160;The couple has <a href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2017/oct/07/google-boss-sundar-pichai-tax-gender-equality-data-protection-jemima-kiss\">two children</a>, Kiran and Kavya, and shares <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/LosAltosTownCrier/photos/a.10151834635180141/10153564581530141/?type=3&#38;theater\">a contemporary home they built themselves</a>, complete with <a href=\"https://www.losaltosonline.com/news/sections/news/199-city-affairs/51790-los-altos-hills-planning-commission-approves-google-ceo-s-home-design\">an infinity pool, wine cellar, and underground nanny quarters</a>, in Los Altos, California.</p><p>According to <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/anjali-pichai-0553691/\">her LinkedIn page</a>, Anjali worked at Accenture as a business analyst until 2002, then began working at Intuit as a business operations manager, although it's not clear if she still works there.&#160;</p>\n\tGriffith R. Harsh IV\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e0e13bd855cc261ca5c64e5?format=jpeg\" alt=\"meg whitman and husband\" height=\"683\" width=\"910\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Meg Whitman and Griffith R. Harsh IV.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Drew Angerer / Getty</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><strong>Partner:</strong> Meg Whitman, former CEO of HP, current CEO of Quibi</p><p><strong>Years married:</strong> 40</p><p><strong>Who he is:</strong> Griffith R. Harsh IV is an accomplished neurosurgeon who <a href=\"https://physicians.ucdavis.edu/medicalcenter/details/32223/griffith-harsh-iv-neurological_surgery-sacramento\">focuses on treating tumors</a> in the brain, pituitary gland, and base of the skull. He's currently the <a href=\"https://www.bizjournals.com/sacramento/news/2018/06/13/uc-davis-health-names-harsh-meg-whitmans-husband.html\">chair of neurological surgery</a> at UC Davis Health. Harsh attended both undergrad and medical school at Harvard University, studied at Oxford University as a Rhodes Scholar, and got an MBA from Boston University.&#160;</p><p><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/amazing-life-of-meg-whitman-2015-10#meg-whitman-is-married-to-brain-surgeon-and-rhodes-scholar-dr-griffith-r-harsh-iv-a-professor-of-neurosurgery-at-stanford-she-met-him-at-when-she-was-a-sophomore-at-princeton-but-they-didnt-date-until-years-later-after-she-invited-him-to-her-sisters-wedding-and-he-forgot-and-blew-her-off-he-then-called-her-to-apologize-and-ask-her-out-what-she-didnt-tell-him-at-the-time-was-that-her-sister-had-also-invited-five-other-attractive-eligible-men-as-potential-dates-for-meg-at-her-wedding-13\">Harsh and Whitman met</a> when Whitman was a sophomore at Princeton University. She invited him to her sister's wedding, but he forgot to attend and accidentally blew her off. The couple eventually made up, and got married in 1980. They have two sons together, Griffith V and William.&#160;</p>\n\tSerena Williams\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e0e18b0855cc25f14190308?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Serena Williams Alexis Ohanian\" height=\"1500\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Serena Williams and Alexis Ohanian.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Gareth Fuller - WPA Pool/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><strong>Partner:</strong> Alexis Ohanian, cofounder of Reddit</p><p><strong>Years married:</strong> Two</p><p><strong>Who she is:</strong> Serena Williams is one of the greatest tennis players, and one of the greatest athletes, of all time. She's won <a href=\"https://www.wtatennis.com/players/230234/serena-williams#bio\">23 grand slam singles titles</a>, four Olympic gold medals, and has won <a href=\"http://wtafiles.wtatennis.com/pdf/rankings/All_Career_Prize_Money.pdf\">$92.5 million</a> in prize money over the course of her career.&#160;</p><p>Williams and Ohanian <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/serena-williams-alexis-ohanian-story-photos-2017-6\">met in May 2015</a> at the Rome Cavalieri hotel, when Ohanian sat down at the table next to Williams' outside by the pool, <a href=\"http://www.vanityfair.com/style/2017/06/serena-williams-cover-story\">according to Vanity Fair</a>. When they first met, Ohanian had never watched tennis and Williams knew nothing about Reddit, the platform Ohanian cofounded in 2005.&#160;The couple had their first official date in June of the year, and by December 2016, <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/BR-zc0sBEd-/?utm_source=ig_embed\">Ohanian proposed</a> at the hotel where they met.</p><p>In early January 2017, Williams <a href=\"http://www.vanityfair.com/style/2017/06/serena-williams-cover-story\">found out she was pregnant</a> &#8212; she gave birth to their daughter, Alexis Olympia Ohanian Jr., in September of that year. The couple <a href=\"https://www.vogue.com/article/serena-williams-wedding-new-orleans\">got married</a> two months later in front of a star-studded guest list that included Beyonc&#233; and Kim Kardashian.&#160;</p>\n\tMacKenzie Scott\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d432d03100a240b6f17f233?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Mackenzie Bezos\" height=\"1109\" width=\"1479\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>MacKenzie Scott.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Taylor Hill/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><strong>Partner:</strong> Jeff Bezos, founder and CEO of Amazon</p><p><strong>Years married:</strong> 26, until their divorce in 2019</p><p><strong>Who she is:</strong> MacKenzie Scott is a writer and philanthropist. She is the author of two novels, the first of which won an American Book Award.&#160;&#160;</p><p>Scott <a href=\"https://www.vogue.com/article/a-novel-perspective-mackenzie-bezos\">studied fiction at Princeton University</a> and worked as a research associate for investment management firm D.E. Shaw, where she met Jeff Bezos. They were married within six months, in 1993. Scott was one of Amazon's earliest employees, working as an accountant for the company.</p><p>In early 2019, Scott and Bezos <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/jeff-bezos-mackenzie-net-worth-billionaires-divorce-2019-1\">announced they were divorcing</a>. In April, she announced she was granting Bezos 75% of their jointly owned Amazon stock, which left her with an estimated $35.6 billion stake, making her one of the richest women on the planet. She has since <a href=\"https://givingpledge.org/Pledger.aspx?id=393\">signed the Giving Pledge</a>. She recently <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/mackenzie-scott-bezos-donated-then-made-back-nearly-two-billion-2020-7\">donated $1.7 billion</a> to 116 different organizations focused on social issues.&#160;</p>\n\tNicole Shanahan\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e0e4a26855cc20ea875b052?format=jpeg\" alt=\"sergey brin nicole shanahan\" height=\"1602\" width=\"2136\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Nicole Shanahan and Sergey Brin.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Kimberly White/Getty Images for Breakthrough Prize</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><strong>Partner:</strong> Sergey Brin, cofounder of Google</p><p><strong>Years married:</strong> Nearly two years</p><p><strong>Who she is:</strong> Nicole Shanahan is the founder of a legal tech company called <a href=\"https://clearaccessip.com/\">ClearAccessIP,</a> which builds an analytics tool for patent lawyers and inventors. She has also been active in women's health and fertility, helping to <a href=\"https://www.buckinstitute.org/news/the-bia-echo-foundation-announces-the-global-consortium-for-female-reproductive-longevity-and-equality-in-partnership-with-the-buck-institute-for-research-on-aging/\">fund a research center</a> focused on reproductive health through her foundation, the Bia-Echo Foundation.&#160;</p><p>Shanahan and Brin were first linked in 2015 after they were <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/lulu-ceo-alexandra-chong-jamaica-wedding-sergey-brin-richard-branson-kate-winslet-princess-eugenie-2015-6\">spotted together</a> at the Jamaica wedding of a dating app CEO. In October 2019, it was revealed that the couple had been married since 2018. They have one child together, a baby girl, who was born in late 2018, <a href=\"https://pagesix.com/2019/10/02/google-founder-sergey-brin-marries-nicole-shanahan/\">according to Page Six</a>. Brin has two other children from his previous marriage to 23andMe CEO Anne Wojcicki, whose older sister is Susan Wojcicki, CEO of YouTube.</p>\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original 55cc25ac97e5920?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn36@2020_1/2020/08/31/17-22-08-488_a621ac6cf89d47b1.webp","https://i.insider.com/5e0e1ee3855cc264a9784fe6?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn40@2020_5/2020/08/31/17-22-09-989_b4b364f3485ab65d.webp","https://i.insider.com/5e0e13bd855cc261ca5c64e5?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn23@2020_4/2020/08/31/17-22-01-159_6bfe274997889531.webp","https://i.insider.com/5e0e18b0855cc25f14190308?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn79@2020_4/2020/08/31/17-21-57-033_4473380792391b45.webp","https://i.insider.com/5d432d03100a240b6f17f233?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn43@2020_1/2020/08/31/17-22-03-964_b467a466ebb68fc3.webp","https://i.insider.com/5e0e4a26855cc20ea875b052?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn7@2020_4/2020/08/31/17-22-07-090_6146f1ed4e2471c4.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn51@2020_3/2020/08/31/17-22-14-421_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=EzjlqC4zIWM:fZoPCQelB-M:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn95@2020_4/2020/08/31/17-22-13-625_3c4067e236eae700.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=EzjlqC4zIWM:fZoPCQelB-M:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn71@2020_5/2020/08/31/17-22-10-552_eb2a16b8d657773d.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn76@2020_1/2020/08/31/17-22-07-798_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=EzjlqC4zIWM:fZoPCQelB-M:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn31@2020_4/2020/08/31/17-22-14-021_6cd8b3f0e9e746b6.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/EzjlqC4zIWM":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn39@2020_6/2020/08/31/17-22-08-559_ad43a061bad0e3dc.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598894512851},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 01:21:52","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 01:21:52","title":"California winemakers are racing to salvage their grape harvests before wildfires destroy them","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/california-fires-wine-country-grapes-coronavirus-2020-8","description":"<div style=\"position:relative; overflow:hidden; padding-bottom:56.25%\">\n<iframe src=\"https://cdn.jwplayer.com/players/0hH0kl18-jZbcmOYf.html\"\nwidth=\"100%\" height=\"100%\" frameborder=\"0\" scrolling=\"auto\" title=\"California winemakers are racing to salvage their grape harvests before wildfires destroy them\"\nstyle=\"position:absolute;\" allowfullscreen></iframe>\n</div><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>The second-largest fire in California history has already burned over 1.6 million acres this year.</li><li>This is the fourth year in a row of devastating fires to rip through wine country. In late 2019, the Kincade Fire destroyed over 100 buildings like the iconic Soda Rock Winery.</li><li>Even if the flames don't reach winemakers' property, \"smoke taint\" can ruin their crop with an ashy taste that is hard to remove.</li><li>And California's predominantly Latino agricultural workers are three times more likely than other workers to be infected by the coronavirus, according to a recent study.</li></ul><p>After four years of worsening fire conditions, California winemakers have been forced to make a difficult decision: salvage what they can before smoke ruins their grapes or lose the crops and hope insurance will cover the losses.</p><p>Since August 15, over <a href=\"https://www.fire.ca.gov/incidents/\">1.6 million acres</a> in California have burned &#8212; an area about the size of Delaware. <a href=\"https://yaleclimateconnections.org/2020/08/climate-change-is-worsening-californias-hellish-wildfires/\">Scientists predict</a> this year will likely mark the state's worst-ever wildfire season.</p><p>In a normal year, the end of summer would mark the beginning of harvest in wine country. Nearly 15 million tourists visit Sonoma and Napa counties annually &#8212; pumping about $4 billion into wineries, hotels, and restaurants, according to state tourism data.&#160;</p><p>\"Right now is the most critical time for the industry and our business and our county,\" Ross Reedy, the director of winemaking for Truett-Hurst Inc., said.</p><p>Reedy has worked in the wine industry for 12 years. He's seen how fires have changed the landscape over the years. He said that 10 years ago, he'd be able to determine when to pick grapes based on their ripeness, now he's at the mercy of fires and wind patterns.</p><p>Even when fires aren't close, winemakers worry about what they call \"smoke taint.\"</p><p>\"If you have smoke that sits in a vineyard over a period of time, it latches onto the skins and the sugar,\" Reedy said. \"It actually creates very heavy barbecue, ashtray kind of characteristics in the wine.\"</p><p>\"You can taste it as an ordinary consumer,\" Mia Van de Water, a master sommelier at Cote Korean Steakhouse in New York, said.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4d0b0c7ffa48002894d1de?format=jpeg\" alt=\"wine fire\" height=\"1124\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Austin Meyer for Business Insider Weekly</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>She said the ashy taste sometimes becomes apparent only after the grapes have been processed and fermented. Batches of affected wine are typically sold in bulk and blended in with other wine to dilute the flavor.</p><p>\"It'll wind up in something like Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi,\" she said, referring to a product that costs under $10 per bottle.</p><p>Some vineyards are just one lost crop away from their business coming to an end.</p><p>\"First of all, it hurts the grower,\" Reedy said. \"So basically he doesn't make any money this year. He limps along. If he was in dire straits, it could potentially kill his business.\"&#160;</p><p>Hotter, drier conditions are becoming part of a \"new normal\" in California. Though <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/california-kincade-fire-sonoma-county-2020-8\">last year's Kincade Fire started because of faulty electrical equipment</a>, this year's combination of a searing heat wave and rare summer lightning storms has kicked off what scientists predict could be a catastrophic fire season.&#160;</p><p>Winemakers are trying their best to adapt, but there are many complications.</p><p>The power at <a href=\"https://www.emmittscorsone.com/\">Emmitt-Scorsone Wines</a> was out for over a week.&#160;&#160;&#160;</p><p>Some vineyards have crop insurance, but it rarely covers all losses. That puts growers like Reedy in a bind: harvest what they can and risk that the wine made from them will have an unpleasant smoke flavor, or let them rot on the vine and file an insurance claim.</p><p>And it means asking field workers to brave rough conditions in the middle of a pandemic. <a href=\"https://www.cirsinc.org/\">A July study</a> showed that California agricultural workers were three times more likely to contract the virus compared with workers in other sectors.</p><p><a href=\"https://www.corazonhealdsburg.org/\">Coraz&#243;n Healdsburg</a>, a local nonprofit, has been distributing food since the pandemic began. On August 21, it offered free COVID-19 testing for the community in the parking lot adjacent to its headquarters. Many of those who show up for testing are agricultural workers and their families.</p><p>\"If somebody is infected with COVID, that could really have a huge impact on the whole operation. And so that's why this testing is so important right now,\" Ariel Kelley, the CEO of the organization, said.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4d0b4d7ffa48002894d1df?format=jpeg\" alt=\"wine fire\" height=\"1122\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Austin Meyer for Business Insider Weekly</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>A majority of agriculture workers in Sonoma County are Spanish speakers. That language barrier can make it difficult to pass on information about COVID-19 and fire evacuations. Some of those who need help most are afraid to ask because of their immigration status, Kelley said.</p><p>\"There will be folks by virtue of all of the alphabet soup of government agencies that show up: the California Office of Emergency Services and all of the different government departments that come. People get nervous and rightfully so,\" Kelley said.</p><p>Despite these challenges, winemakers are taking steps to protect their workers and their grapes. Organizations like <a href=\"https://sonomawinegrape.org/\">Sonoma County Winegrowers</a> provide fire-safety training. Others have produced instructional videos about COVID-19 for Spanish-speaking workers.</p><p>In St. Helena, California, <a href=\"https://www.etslabs.com/home\">ETS Laboratories</a> developed a test to detect smoke taint in grapes. This year they've already received 1,000 samples for testing, according to Karissa Kruse, the president of Sonoma County Winegrowers. Kruse also oversees <a href=\"https://www.scggf.org/\">a foundation</a> that provides emergency relief to agricultural workers affected by fires.</p><p>But many growers, like Palmer Emmitt of Emmitt-Scorsone Wines, remain optimistic about the industry's future.</p><p>\"Hopefully this is not going to be an annual occurrence. But Sonoma County and the wine industry are resilient, and I think we'll survive and keep chugging,\" Emmitt said.</p><p>In the wee hours of August 23, Reedy's crew finished their emergency pick. It seems that the day's haul has a future in bottles as ros&#233;.</p><p>\"We would have loved to have turned this into a still red wine, but you gotta do what you gotta do,\" Reedy said.</p><div (Austin Meyer,Daniel T. Allen)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f4d0b0c7ffa48002894d1de?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn44@2020_1/2020/08/31/17-22-19-397_24de8637b938b4ee.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f4d0b4d7ffa48002894d1df?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn31@2020_5/2020/08/31/17-22-08-457_8ebbfa22cc2bd335.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn51@2020_3/2020/08/31/17-22-14-421_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=V2RvLJXuN7Y:Bh7pQEoFSX4:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn12@2020_1/2020/08/31/17-22-12-502_75dda090629e98b3.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=V2RvLJXuN7Y:Bh7pQEoFSX4:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn80@2020_5/2020/08/31/17-22-11-908_c4f0150713f1de93.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn76@2020_1/2020/08/31/17-22-07-798_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=V2RvLJXuN7Y:Bh7pQEoFSX4:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn95@2020_4/2020/08/31/17-22-18-400_f707bd87dfe892c6.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/V2RvLJXuN7Y":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn51@2020_5/2020/08/31/17-21-58-614_66666cc0fcc29274.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598894512906},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 01:21:52","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 01:21:52","title":"A major new game faced backlash for using imagery associated with Black Lives Matter to portray an authoritarian movement","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/ubisoft-tom-clancy-will-remove-black-fist-protest-imagery-2020-8","description":"<figure> \n <img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4cfa7e60bf1f00280796d9?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Tom Clancy's Elite Squad\" height=\"1316\" width=\"2880\" charset=\"\"> \n  <figcaption>\n   An image from the new Ubisoft game \"Tom Clancy's Elite Squad.\" \n   <p class=\"copyright\">Ubisoft</p> \n  </figcaption> </img>\n</figure>\n<ul class=\"summary-list\">\n <li><strong>A new Tom Clancy smartphone game features imagery of protesters alongside raised fists that resemble symbolism for the the Black rights movement in the US.</strong></li>\n <li><strong>The game's intro says the protesters are actually a front for a secret organization named \"UMBRA.\" The group \"claim to promote an egalitarian utopia to gain popular support,\" but are secretly sowing discord.&nbsp;</strong></li>\n <li><strong>People widely criticized the game over the weekend, which forced a response from French publisher Ubisoft. </strong></li>\n <li><strong>\"Imagery that appeared in the opening video sequence of 'Tom Clancy's Elite Squad' featuring a 'raised fist' was insensitive and harmful in both its inclusion and how it was portrayed,\" the company said.</strong></li>\n <li><strong>The game's publisher also pledged to update the game's use of the <a href=\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Raised_fist\">decades-old protest symbol</a>.</strong></li>\n <li><strong><a href=\"http://www.businessinsider.com/\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories.</a></strong></li>\n</ul>\n<p>The use of the raised fist — also known as the Black Power fist, <a href=\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Raised_fist\">a decades-old protest symbol</a> closely associated with the Black rights movement in the United States — in the intro to \"Tom Clancy's Elite Squad\" is at the heart of criticisms of the new smartphone game.</p>\n<p>In the new smartphone game from French game publisher Ubisoft, an intro video depicts a world \"in an alarming state,\" a narrator says. \"Wars, corruption, and poverty have made it more unstable than ever.\"</p>\n<p>Protesters can be seen clashing with police as fires rage, and slogans like \"Power to the People!\" have been spray painted on billboards and protest signs.</p>\n<p>But the imagery becomes more specific as the intro movie continues, with raised Black fists and populist protest movements being depicted as a cover for a group named \"UMBRA\" which seeks to \"build a new world order.\"</p>\n<p>Following criticism of the game's depiction of the raised fist over the weekend, Ubisoft apologized and said it will remove the imagery in an upcoming update.</p>\n<p>\"Imagery that appeared in the opening video sequence of 'Tom Clancy's Elite Squad' featuring a 'raised fist' was insensitive and harmful in both its inclusion and how it was portrayed,\" the company said in a message posted to Twitter over the weekend.</p>\n<p>\"We have listened to and appreciate the players and the broader community who have pointed it out and we apologize,\" the message said. \"This 'raised fist' imagery will be removed in the next title update.\"</p>\n<p>Ubisoft has been rocked by recent <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/ubisoft-faces-new-allegations-of-sexual-harassment-and-toxic-culture-2020-7\">allegations of sexual misconduct within the company</a>. A number of executives have left in the wake of <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/ubisoft-faces-new-allegations-of-sexual-harassment-and-toxic-culture-2020-7\">the claims</a>, including the company's Vice President of editorial and creative services <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/ubisoft-sexual-harassment-allegations-tommy-francois-leaves-company-yves-guillemot2020-8\">Tommy Francois</a>.&nbsp;</p>\n<p>Watch the full video from \"Tom Clancy's Elite Squad\" right here:</p>\n<iframe width=\"800\" height=\"450\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/aHug_-13tDU\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\"></iframe>\n<p><em><strong>Got a tip?</strong>&nbsp;Contact Business Insider senior correspondent Ben Gilbert via email (<a href=\"mailto:bgilbert@businessinsider.com\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\">bgilbert@businessinsider.com</a>),</em><em>&nbsp;or Twitter DM (<a href=\"https://twitter.com/RealBenGilbert\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\">@realbengilbert</a>). We can keep sources anonymous. Use a non-work device to reach out. PR pitches by email only, please.</em></p>\n<div class=\"read-original\">\n Read the original article on \n <a border=\"0\" /></a> \n</div>\n<img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/4K-SUzUsgzw\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\" />","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 31 Aug 2020 16:25:58 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f4d063a60bf1f002807970e?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"5a49d8910cff3ccff303524ea51e5eb3","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn35@2020_5/2020/08/31/17-21-55-960_72ad9ce34fc69f1c.webp","destWidth":1556,"destHeight":1167,"sourceBytes":55238,"destBytes":55238,"author":"insider@insider.com (Ben Gilbert)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f4cfa7e60bf1f00280796d9?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn79@2020_2/2020/08/31/17-22-00-366_4e10a4b19cfabd85.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn51@2020_3/2020/08/31/17-22-14-421_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=4K-SUzUsgzw:5M7UE7WxjpU:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn24@2020_3/2020/08/31/17-22-12-908_83fb00632ec0280e.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=4K-SUzUsgzw:5M7UE7WxjpU:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn84@2020_6/2020/08/31/17-22-07-814_3772b14260ce53c8.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn76@2020_1/2020/08/31/17-22-07-798_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=4K-SUzUsgzw:5M7UE7WxjpU:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn100@2020_2/2020/08/31/17-22-18-509_e180f88773897027.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/4K-SUzUsgzw":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn55@2020_3/2020/08/31/17-22-16-062_5c90bd00f9b8f219.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598894512798},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 01:21:52","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 01:21:52","title":"The easiest Wi-Fi mesh systems to set up","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/easy-wi-fi-mesh-systems","description":"<ul class=\"summary-list\"><li><strong>Forget the old wireless routers that needed some technical skills to set them up. Each of these picks are able to be installed using just a mobile phone or tablet.</strong></li><li><strong>Most of these mesh systems can be set up in 10-15 minutes and only require plugging them into electrical outlets to become operational.</strong></li><li><strong>After setup, these mesh systems can be fully controlled and changed right from an app on your phone and don't require any networking skills to maintain them.</strong></li></ul><p>Mesh networking and wireless routers with multiple access points are a complicated category by default. Each unit works in conjunction with the others to create one large wireless network in your house and pull different amounts of bandwidth depending on how you move about your home.<strong>&#160;</strong></p><p>While the potential for headache is all around, we've picked the top mesh systems that are the easiest to install and get setup in no time. Just a few years ago, configuring a wireless network required an ethernet cable and knowing the IP address associated with different manufacturers &#8212; no more.</p><p>All of these systems can be configured, used, changed, and tweaked using a mobile device, like your phone or tablet. Each also has step-by-step informational screens that walk you through the setup process so you shouldn't need an instructional manual either.<strong>&#160;</strong></p><p>I worked as a home computer technician for a decade and setting up a wireless router was always a pain. I've also written about routers and smart home gadgets for years. We've personally tried these mesh systems out and can confirm each is simple enough that network administrators will be out of side work very soon.</p><h2>Here are the easiest mesh Wifi systems</h2><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li><strong>Easiest mesh system overall: <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07WGJ8ZD3/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=biipgf_082820_easy-wi-fi-mesh-systems-20&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B07WGJ8ZD3&linkId=cd4665879b0f2c46be955f22e7db0edf9b0f2c46be955f22e7db0edf\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Eero</a></strong></li><li><strong>Easiest mesh system for smart homes: <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07YMKD6SM/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=biipgf_082820_easy-wi-fi-mesh-systems-20&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B07YMKD6SM&linkId=6bba039b500ed73ed44608c1945f979b500ed73ed44608c1945f979b\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Nest Wifi</a></strong></li><li><strong>Easiest mesh system for add-on features: <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B01N2NLNEH/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=biipgf_082820_easy-wi-fi-mesh-systems-20&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B01N2NLNEH&linkId=5815b43868ad0772559df9dc8319da1c68ad0772559df9dc8319da1c\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Linksys Velop</a></strong></li><li><strong>Easiest mesh system for parental controls: <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B01K4CZOBS/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=biipgf_082820_easy-wi-fi-mesh-systems-20&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B01K4CZOBS&linkId=5238714ff65bad7565e5a0f31f48de1ef65bad7565e5a0f31f48de1e\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Netgear Orbi</a></strong></li><li><strong>Easiest mesh system for early adopters: <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0823JXXX4/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=biipgf_082820_easy-wi-fi-mesh-systems-20&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B0823JXXX4&linkId=d3c0057a75afaf2872735fc233d8ab0a75afaf2872735fc233d8ab0a\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Netgear Nighthawk WiFi 6</a></strong></li></ul>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tThe easiest mesh system overall\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f492664cd2fec00296a4caa?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Eero wifi router\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>Back in the dark days between when wireless networking first emerged and the present, <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07WGJ8ZD3/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_082820_easy-wi-fi-mesh-systems-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B07WGJ8ZD3&#38;linkId=cd4665879b0f2c46be955f22e7db0edf\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Eero</a> kicked out a revolution for how consumers can be the masters of their domains.</h3><p>Eero didn't invent the concept of wireless mesh networking, but <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07WGJ8ZD3/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_082820_easy-wi-fi-mesh-systems-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B07WGJ8ZD3&#38;linkId=cd4665879b0f2c46be955f22e7db0edf\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Eero</a> greatly improved it and managed to bring homes across the world into the light.</p><p>In being among the first to market, Eero has had time to perfect its simplified app design, hardware, and setup process. Many advanced users scoffed at Eero's mobile app setup process that did away with browser-based set up interfaces in lieu of using the device that resided in everyone's pocket.</p><p>Eero uses Bluetooth in its router units to detect phones and tablets and get the setup process started. All you need to do is to unbox the units and plug them in. Another area of focus <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07WGJ8ZD3/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_082820_easy-wi-fi-mesh-systems-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B07WGJ8ZD3&#38;linkId=cd4665879b0f2c46be955f22e7db0edf\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Eero</a> highlights as it walks you through the few setup steps is about router placement.</p><p>Eero has long focused on making sure users were getting the best wireless coverage possible from their new mesh system by educating them on the best placement for router units. All of this is done with few words and animated image guides.</p><p>Even after Amazon's purchase, <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07WGJ8ZD3/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_082820_easy-wi-fi-mesh-systems-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B07WGJ8ZD3&#38;linkId=cd4665879b0f2c46be955f22e7db0edf\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Eero</a> largely remains a premium networking product, but there are several configurations of the product that mostly revolve around how big your home is and how much coverage you need.</p><p><strong>Pros</strong>: Long focused on simplicity, affordable base system, remote access</p><p><strong>Cons</strong>: No smart home features integrated</p>\n\tThe easiest mesh system for smart homes\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f492736db1ed00029714821?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Nest Wifi Router\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>Google's <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07YMKD6SM/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_082820_easy-wi-fi-mesh-systems-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B07YMKD6SM&#38;linkId=6bba039b500ed73ed44608c1945f979b\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Nest Wifi mesh system</a> has been a staple of ease-of-use since its inception, Google too making one of the first mesh networking routers to only use a mobile app for setup and access to all settings.&#160;</h3><p>The latest Nest Wifi continues Google's home networking efforts from its early OnHub days and attempts to streamline wireless networking, even if you know nothing about it. Not only is it dead-simple to set up with your phone, but Nest Wifi includes convenient smart home features.</p><p>The add-on units for the mesh system include microphones and speakers and act as their own Google Assistant speakers. You can ask for the weather, to play music, or even get help with your wireless system. For example, you can perform an internet speed test just by asking, without even having to open your app.</p><p>Google recently integrated the Wifi system into its Home app so, in the same way you'd set up a new Home Hub or other assistant, everything is now in one app. This is mostly a good move. The down side however is that there are a lot of settings and options lurking around every corner. Newcomers should not be afraid, but just aware that learning the app's navigation could take a little time to become completely familiar.</p><p><strong>Pros:</strong> Integrated into Google Home app, easy as setting up a Google Assistant</p><p><strong>Cons:</strong> Not fully merged with Google Wifi app yet</p>\n\tThe easiest mesh system for add-on features\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f49287edb1ed0002971482c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Linksys Velop\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>Linksys, now owned by Belkin, has the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B01N2NLNEH/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_082820_easy-wi-fi-mesh-systems-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B01N2NLNEH&#38;linkId=5815b43868ad0772559df9dc8319da1c\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Linksys Velop</a> mesh networking system which contains one of the easiest setup processes from this bunch.</h3><p>It too is done completely from a mobile app and doesn't even come with any instructions in the box because of its simplicity. There are several models of Linksys' Velop mesh system, but the difference is really in the hardware capability, such as range and specifications. The app and software is largely the same no matter which one you get. We recently reviewed the AC220 system and it was a piece of cake to get going for the first time.</p><p>The longest part of the process is waiting five-to-six minutes for it to find new units and automatically configure them with your existing settings. The only thing you're doing during that time is waiting, so it's not hard.</p><p>Not only are Velop mesh systems easy to set up, but they also include a few add-on features for added value. You can add on more advanced parental controls to more finely target what your kids' device can and can't access. You can also pay an additional yearly fee to turn your mesh system into a home motion detector. It works simply through sonar, by detecting differences in the wireless radio waves throughout your home, and then can alert you remotely when there is motion inside your home.</p><p>The nice thing about the motion feature is that it acts in a sophisticated manner for security purposes, but doesn't require any more hardware or even any more technical skills to get it going. It's all confined and accessible with the mesh system and app.</p><p><strong>Pros:</strong> Fun and useful add-on features, variety of Velop systems to choose from</p><p><strong>Cons:</strong> Add-on advanced features aren't free</p>\n\tThe easiest mesh system for parental controls\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f49295adb1ed00029714831?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Netgear Orbi\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B01K4CZOBS/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_082820_easy-wi-fi-mesh-systems-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B01K4CZOBS&#38;linkId=5238714ff65bad7565e5a0f31f48de1e\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Netgear's Orbi</a> mesh system is largely lauded for its backhaul channels resulting in premium speeds while streaming lots of data &#8212; but it's also full of peace of mind with its parental controls.</h3><p>If you do choose an Orbi mesh system, you'll be pleasantly thrilled with its technical feats, but first and foremost, you should be very happy with its setup and ease of use.</p><p>The Orbi app is really paired down on first glance which makes it very simple for the casual interactions and getting started. Like other systems in this guide, Orbi uses a mobile app on your phone or tablet to connect and input the few needed settings like network name and password.</p><p>It also includes features like speed testing right up front inside the app as it prioritizes key interactions. Beyond the basics however, Netgear partnered with Disney's Circle for advanced and very easy-to-use parental controls.</p><p>Circle knows about the latest apps which you might want to limit and offers a way to give time limits and restrictions for different devices. Kids of different ages will need to be treated differently so that consideration is also built into the Circle settings.</p><p>For select Orbi systems you're also able to control settings via your voice. Some have Google Assistant built-in and so you can just ask it to pause your Wi-Fi or enable a guest network if you need to.</p><p><strong>Pros</strong>: Simple interface, advanced parental controls by Circle</p><p><strong>Cons</strong>: Orbi systems are usually priced high</p>\n\tThe easiest mesh system for early adopters\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f492f0560bf1f0028079319?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Nighthawk wifi 6\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0823JXXX4/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_082820_easy-wi-fi-mesh-systems-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B0823JXXX4&#38;linkId=d3c0057a75afaf2872735fc233d8ab0a\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Neatgear's Nighthawk</a> line of routers originated out of its more advanced networking solutions and now includes a mesh option.</h3><p>Small, pointy black boxes give the Nighthawk mesh system a sleek and modern look, though may be more obvious around a home than other routers. Still, the Nighthawk mesh system with WiFi 6 is definitely for the early adopters, who still want an easy way to manage and set up their wireless routers. WiFi 6 is a rebranding of wireless protocols for the latest generation of specs. It includes four times more connections and has other improvements as gaming and streaming video take over everyone's wireless usage.</p><p>The Nighthawk mesh system includes a similar app experience to Netgear's Orbi. Both come from the same company so there's a good bit of overlap which makes it nice if you decide to upgrade from one to the other at some point.</p><p>Like the rest of these picks, the Nighthawk mobile app offers a simple and cohesive way to get your wireless system going. The setup process requires inputting only a minimal amount of data, such as giving your network a distinct name and password before you're up and going.</p><p>The app also allows access to prioritize devices on your network if you have an important video call you want to make sure gets all the data it needs. On and off toggles provide an incredibly easy way to stop devices from using your internet and connecting to your network if you need to police a rogue user. A handy network map can show which devices are actually connected and using your home internet connection.</p><p>Overall, the Nighthawk mesh WiFi 6 system can give next generation-level specs with only a few minutes to get started and set up. At $199 at the time of writing too, the two device mesh system is a steal.</p><p><strong>Pros</strong>: Next generation wireless protocols, easy to access advanced controls, affordable</p><p><strong>Cons</strong>: Advanced security through Bitdefender is an add-on cost</p>\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a 01:21:52","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 01:21:52","title":"Pop-up picnics are the new millennial brunch","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/millennials-renting-picnics-during-pandemic-2020-8","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f49097ddb1ed00029714766?format=jpeg\" alt=\"picnics in the city.JPG\" height=\"2201\" width=\"2935\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A picnic set-up by Picnics in the City in Houston, Texas.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Courtesy of Martha Suarez, Picnics in the City</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>Young adults are turning to picnic rentals during the pandemic.</li><li>Picnickers told Business Insider the outdoor dining setups allow them to safely socially distance &#8212; plus they make for great Instagram photos.</li><li>To see how demand has changed and what offerings are the most popular, Business Insider spoke with three picnic rental founders from LA to Chicago.</li><li>Their picnics range in price from $200 to more than $1,000. Some offer add-ons like photographers and a yoga class.</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li></ul><p>Rio Schwalbach's now-fianc&#233; arranged a bohemian pop-up picnic proposal on California's Harbor Patrol Beach last September. Little did she know, picnics like this would become<strong>&#160;</strong>a socially distanced solution to her future quarantine boredom.</p><p>The scene, set up by LA-based picnic rental company <a href=\"https://thepicniccollective.com/\">The Picnic Collective</a>, was replete with a teepee, a table brimming with macaroons and flowers, and tasseled pillows. Jason Mraz's \"I Won't Give Up\" served as the soundtrack and there was, of course, a hidden photographer to capture it all.&#160;</p><p>\"It was the most amazing proposal ever,\" Schwalbach, 29, told Business Insider.</p><p>Schwalbach would go on to enlist The Picnic Collective's help twice in the next year as the coronavirus pandemic swept the US. In March, she ordered a picnic basket filled with cheese, fruit, and flowers for an at-home date night. In July, she worked with The Picnic Collective to set up a beach-themed surprise picnic for her friend's 30th birthday.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f490251cd2fec00296a4bb5?format=jpeg\" alt=\"rio schwalbach\" height=\"819\" width=\"1093\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The 30th birthday surprise picnic Rio Schwalbach set up for her friend.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Rio Schwalbach</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>As young adults like Schwalbach seek to keep special occasions special or look for new activities to do with friends during the pandemic, they're turning to the relatively new business of picnic rentals. Business Insider spoke with three picnic rental founders who all said their clientele consists primarily of 20- to 30-something females looking for new ways to celebrate major life milestones: marriages, birthdays, baby showers, gender reveals, proposals, and bachelorette parties.</p><h2>Picnics are prime for Instagram</h2><p>Lauren Rivard, a 26-year-old former marketing director, told Business Insider she started the The Picnic Collective in 2018 after noticing a gap in the market for outdoor gatherings. She now has 10 full-time employees.</p><p>\"To do something like this, you would have to hire an event planner and get rentals or coordinate florals or find a caterer,\" she said. \"So I just wanted to make it a one-stop-shop situation.\"</p><p>Newport and Malibu locations are some of the company's most popular picnic destinations, she said. It has set up picnics on the beaches of San Diego, Orange County, and Los Angeles and in the deserts and parks of Las Vegas. Rivard said that in the past month, they set up 200 picnics, averaging around 40 a week.</p><p>The Picnic Collective has two main packages, Rivard said, both of which are designed for two people: the Simple Pleasures package, which starts at $250, and the Bliss Package, which includes a farm table upgrade starting at $350. All picnics come with cheese boards and florals, plus set-up and clean-up. Picnickers looking to go ultra deluxe can also book a dessert station or yoga class for additional fees of up to $400. Rivard said it takes the team about 90 minutes to set up each picnic.</p><blockquote class=\"instagram-media\"   style=\"background:#FFF; border:0; border-radius:3px; box-shadow:0 0 1px 0 rgba(0,0,0,0.5),0 1px 10px 0 rgba(0,0,0,0.15); margin: 1px; max-width:540; padding:0; width:99.375%; width:-webkit-calc(100% - 2px); width:calc(100% - 2px); data.width~540;\">\n\t<div style=\"padding:8px;\">\n\t\t<div style=\"background:#F8F8F8; line-height:0; margin-top:40px; padding:62.4537037037% 0; text-align:center; width:100%;\">\n\t\t\t<div style=\"background:url(data:image/png;base64,); display:block; height:44px; margin:0 auto -44px; position:relative; top:-22px; width:44px;\"></div>\n\t\t</div>\n\t\t<p style=\"margin:8px 0 0 0; padding:0 4px;\">\n\t\t\t<a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/CC9MFQDnPW_\" style=\" color:#000; font-family:Arial,sans-serif; font-size:14px; font-style:normal; font-weight:normal; line-height:17px; text-decoration:none; word-wrap:break-word;\" target=\"_blank\"></a></p> <p style=\" color:#c9c8cd; font-family:Arial,sans-serif; font-size:14px; line-height:17px; margin-bottom:0; margin-top:8px; overflow:hidden; padding:8px 0 7px; text-align:center; text-overflow:ellipsis; white-space:nowrap;\">A post shared by Cassie Randolph (@cassierandolph)<time style=\" font-family:Arial,sans-serif; font-size:14px; line-height:17px;\" datetime=\"2020-07-22T19:27:30+00:00\">Jul 22, 2020 at 12:27pm PDT</time>\n\t\t</p></div></blockquote><script async defer src=\"//platform.instagram.com/en_US/embeds.js\"></script><p>&#160;</p><p>The picnics' coastal or bohemian aeshetics are prime Instagram porn, and thus natural influencer fodder. Members of Bachelor Nation, from <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/CC9MFQDnPW_/\">Cassie Randolph</a> to <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/B--XtoHpsge/\">Bekah Martinez</a>, have been posting picnics with The Picnic Collective throughout quarantine (Rivard says the company sometimes does paid events or collaborations with influencers).</p><p>The \"Bachelor\" association was part of the appeal for Schwalbach's friend, a \"Bachelor\" fan, during her birthday surprise picnic. \"She was so excited that she pretended to be on 'The Bachelor,'\" Schwalbach said.</p><h2>Picnics are made for social distancing</h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f49334b60bf1f0028079357?format=jpeg\" alt=\"drive thru baby shower.JPG\" height=\"4032\" width=\"3024\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A peacock chair in a set-up for a  baby shower by Picnics in the City in Houston, Texas.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Courtesy of Picnics in the City</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>Over in Houston, Martha Suarez of <a href=\"https://picnicsinthecity.com/\">Picnics in the City</a> told Business Insider she's seen a shift in the type of picnic people want during the pandemic. Picnic set-ups for 40-plus people in public places have given way to 10-person picnics at home.</p><p>Picnics here start at $169 for two guests; more people can be added for $20 a head. The company also offers various add-ons, the most popular of which, she said, are a teepee, wooden arch, and peacock chair.</p><p>Suarez founded Picnics in the City in March 2019 and drew inspiration from her time living in Paris. \"I would love picnicking by the Eiffel Tower and I wanted to bring a similar experience looking at the Houston skyline,\" she said.</p><p>That's exactly the experience Samantha Hentosh, 24, got when her fianc&#233; proposed in April. She told Business Insider the pandemic foiled his original plan to propose in Paris, so he turned to Picnics in the City instead.</p><p>Picnics in the City has been doing a contactless drop-off of picnic supplies rather than the standard set-up, so Hentosh's now-fianc&#233; set up a picnic in their favorite spot in Buffalo Bayou Park. The low picnic table was littered with photos of the two of them, a gauzy white runner, candlesticks, and orange flowers, all surrounded by cozy pillows.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f490367db1ed00029714732?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Allison Ermon Photography\" height=\"845\" width=\"1125\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Samantha Hentosh&#39;s proposal.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/allisonermon_photography/?hl=en\" target=\"_blank\">Allison Ermon Photography</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Meanwhile, others just want something fun to do. Marla Milano, 27, told Business Insider her friend set up a girls' picnic in Chicago with <a href=\"https://www.picnicsinthechi.com/\">Picnics in the Chi</a> earlier in August. The friend, Milano said, was looking for a safer alternative to eating inside restaurants.&#160;</p><p>Prices for Picnics in the Chi range from $199 for a basic set-up for two to $1,350 for a custom birthday celebration or gender reveal, founder Tunji Sanni told Business Insider. Milano's friend booked a luxury package for seven, which the group split at $88 per person; it&#160;included everything from a Bluetooth speaker and silk flowers to a cheese plate and cake.</p><p>\"I felt safe from a social disancing perspective, much more so than being on a restaurant patio,\" Milano said. \"It was a great way to catch up with friends and get some cute photos too.\"</p><p>Sanni said she created Picnics in the Chi in May to provide a fun, safe space for get-togethers that will relieve coronavirus-stress. She said she's seen a 47% increase in picnic rental requests from June to July.&#160;</p><p>\"Picnics are the new brunch,\" she said.&#160;</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on
