01:21:52","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 01:21:52","title":"6 inexpensive products I swear by to give myself a salon-grade manicure at home","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/at-home-manicure-nail-products-on-a-budget","description":"<p class=\"financial-disclaimer\"><i>When you buy through our links, we may earn money from our affiliate partners. <a href=\"https://www.insider-inc.com/commerce-on-insider-inc/\">Learn more.</a></i></p><p><a href=\"http://goto.target.com/c/196318/81938/2092?subId1=biip_031819_at-home-manicure&u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.target.com%2Fp%2Fsinful-colors-professional-nail-polish-0-5-fl-oz%2F-%2FA-53732772%3Fpreselect%3D16640108%23lnk%3Dsametabetab\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored\"><em><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5c8ff66f69e11c22cb1225b6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"SinfulColors finished manicure\" height=\"675\" width=\"900\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">SinfulColors</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></em></a></p><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>Getting a professional manicure once a week would cost a minimum of $40 a month, or about $480 a year.</li><li>I put together a list of six products I use at home to get salon results, all of which last me at least six months, some even longer.</li><li>My routine involves a simple <a href=\"http://goto.target.com/c/196318/81938/2092?subId1=biip_031819_at-home-manicure&u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.target.com%2Fp%2Ftrim-salon-board-2pk-black%2F-%2FA-110587648764\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">nail file</a> and <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00YRBWOWU/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=biip_031819_at-home-manicure-20&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B00YRBWOWU&linkId=8958abbb8c1fe4f57b325952f74b0d388c1fe4f57b325952f74b0d38\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored\">buffer block</a>, <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B000FZDPW0/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=biip_031819_at-home-manicure-20&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B000FZDPW0&linkId=af8c72612f08506f7304ffdb9920f1b02f08506f7304ffdb9920f1b0\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored\">base coat</a>, <a href=\"http://goto.target.com/c/196318/81938/2092?subId1=biip_031819_at-home-manicure&u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.target.com%2Fp%2Fsinful-colors-professional-nail-polish-0-5-fl-oz%2F-%2FA-53732772%3Fpreselect%3D16640108%23lnk%3Dsametabetab\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored\">nail polish color</a>, and <a href=\"https://goto.target.com/c/196318/81938/2092?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.target.com%2Fp%2Finm-out-the-door-super-fast-dry-top-coat-0-5-fl-oz%2F-%2FA-16831182\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow nofollow sponsored\">top coat</a> &#8212; with a&#160;<a href=\"http://goto.target.com/c/196318/81938/2092?subId1=biip_031819_at-home-manicure&u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.target.com%2Fp%2Fsally-hansen-nail-treatment-45129-instant-cuticle-remover-1-fl-oz%2F-%2FA-524762436243\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow nofollow nofollow sponsored\">cuticle product</a> recommended to me by a coworker as a bonus. All of these products cost around $30 total.&#160;</li></ul><p>My friends and coworkers are always asking me where I get my nails done, and they're totally shocked when my response is that I do them at home. I prefer to have my nails painted at all times and I tend to put a fresh coat on every week (or every other week if I'm feeling lazy). I'm being totally honest when I say I only treat myself to a manicure and pedicure once a year for my birthday.</p><p>If I went to a nail salon on a weekly basis and paid for a $10 manicure, I'd be spending $40 a month or $480 a year &#8212; and honestly, that's a low-balled estimate. I live in New Jersey so expect those prices to be higher if you live in New York or another city. On top of that, who has an hour or two every week to get pampered? I wish, but I'm not a Real Housewife.</p><p>On top of that, I prefer to paint my nails dark colors like black cherry, midnight navy, and even black, so it's painfully obvious when my polish starts to chip. I've tried different brands of nail polish and gimmicky products to make my nails last through the week and I've finally cracked the code &#8212; including a quick drying top coat that's my secret weapon.</p><h3>Trust me when I say you'll only need these six products to give your natural nails a salon-grade manicure at home &#8212; and at under $30 total, they won't break the bank.</h3>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tA nail file\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5c8fee14401d580a860fac58?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Trim nail file\" height=\"600\" width=\"800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Target</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"http://goto.target.com/c/196318/81938/2092?subId1=biip_031819_at-home-manicure&#38;u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.target.com%2Fp%2Ftrim-salon-board-2pk-black%2F-%2FA-11058764\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored\">Trim Salon Board (two-pack), available at Target for $1.29</a></h3><p>Now I know what you're thinking: <em>It's just a nail file, they're all the same</em>. Well, no &#8212; not entirely. There are actually <a href=\"https://dtknailsupply.com/blog/best-nail-file-for-natuatal-nails\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">several types of nail files</a>, but the most common one is an emery board. Depending on the type of nail (natural or artificial), you'll need to use different grit levels.</p><p>The lower the grit level, the coarser the file, and conversely, the higher the grit level, the smoother it'll be. For artificial nails, a grit level of 100 should be used, while natural nails tend to require a grit level of 180.</p><p>The <a href=\"http://goto.target.com/c/196318/81938/2092?subId1=biip_031819_at-home-manicure&#38;u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.target.com%2Fp%2Ftrim-salon-board-2pk-black%2F-%2FA-11058764\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored\">Trim Salon Board</a> is designed for multi-use. One side of the board has a medium grit, while the other side has a coarse grit. They are also attached to a thick and sturdy board, so you don't need to worry about snapping it in half as you file away.&#160;</p><p>I only use the <a href=\"http://goto.target.com/c/196318/81938/2092?subId1=biip_031819_at-home-manicure&#38;u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.target.com%2Fp%2Ftrim-salon-board-2pk-black%2F-%2FA-11058764\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored\">Trim Salon Board</a> on the edges of my nails to shape and file them, never on the surface to buffer and smooth. I use a basic buffer, listed in the slide below, to smooth the tops of my nails before applying polish.</p>\n\tA nail buffer block\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5c8feec169bdec0c67301db7?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Tweezerman nail buffer\" height=\"673\" width=\"898\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Tweezerman</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00YRBWOWU/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biip_031819_at-home-manicure-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B00YRBWOWU&#38;linkId=8958abbb8c1fe4f57b325952f74b0d38\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored\">Tweezerman 4-in-1 File, Smooth, &#38; Shine Block, available at Amazon for $9.99</a></h3><p>After you've filed the edge of your nails (which, by the way, you can use one side of this block for), it's time to buffer the tops of them so your nail polish goes on smooth. I'm guilty of committing the age old sin of nail biting, so thin layers of my nail protein peel off and make my natural nails look flaky.&#160;</p><p>I really should stop biting my nails, but it's harder than it seems and it's way easier to spend two minutes buffing my nails anyway. This <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00YRBWOWU/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biip_031819_at-home-manicure-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B00YRBWOWU&#38;linkId=8958abbb8c1fe4f57b325952f74b0d38\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored\">Tweezerman block</a> has really helped clean up the damage that I've done to my nails by removing all of the flaky nail protein and restoring the surface of my nails.</p><p>This block comes with four sides: a file, a buffer, a smoother, and a shiner. While I really only use the buffer and smoother side, this <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00YRBWOWU/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biip_031819_at-home-manicure-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B00YRBWOWU&#38;linkId=8958abbb8c1fe4f57b325952f74b0d38\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored\">four-in-one block</a> is the only tool you need to use prior to applying nail polish.&#160;</p><p><strong>To use:</strong></p><p><strong>Step 1: </strong>Use the file side to shape and file down your nails.&#160;</p><p><strong>Step 2: </strong>Use the buffer side to remove any flaky and uneven bumps from the entire nail.</p><p><strong>Step 3: </strong>Use the smooth side to remove any other finer imperfections from the new nail surface.</p><p><strong>Step 4: </strong>Use the shine side to give your nails a salon-finish shine. Now you're ready for polish.</p><p>The best thing about this <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00YRBWOWU/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biip_031819_at-home-manicure-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B00YRBWOWU&#38;linkId=8958abbb8c1fe4f57b325952f74b0d38\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored\">Tweezerman block</a> is that it comes with replacement pads. It makes the product last longer, and you don't need to worry if you've out-used your buffer but your file is still going strong.</p>\n\tAn inexpensive base coat\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5c8ff1935dfa9913b10e9210?format=jpeg\" alt=\"first base by essie\" height=\"600\" width=\"800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Essie</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B000FZDPW0/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biip_031819_at-home-manicure-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B000FZDPW0&#38;linkId=af8c72612f08506f7304ffdb9920f1b0\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">First Base by Essie, available at Amazon for $9.00</a></h3><p>A base coat is important to use because it preps the nail surface so that the nail polish goes on smooth and protects your natural nail from getting stained by your polish color. A good base coat helps bond your polish of choice to your nail to further prevent chipping.</p><p>Like I mention in the next slide, I won't spend more than a few bucks on a nail polish color, but a base coat is a little different. For this, I trust <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B000FZDPW0/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biip_031819_at-home-manicure-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B000FZDPW0&#38;linkId=af8c72612f08506f7304ffdb9920f1b0\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">First Base by Essie</a> and think their base coat is worth the money spent for the results I get.&#160;</p><p>I apply just a thin layer to protect my natural nail. Personally, I avoid applying too much of this base coat because I don't want a ton of paint layers on my nails (one layer of base coat, two layers of polish color, and one layer of top coat).&#160;</p><p><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/customer-reviews/R2RVUJOAA1NRZD/ref=cm_cr_arp_d_rvw_ttl?ie=UTF8&#38;ASIN=B000FZDPW0&#38;_encoding=UTF8&#38;tag=biip_031819_at-home-manicure-20&#38;linkCode=ur2&#38;linkId=79d9af08980390a3fb678b2bc2968c58&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">One Amazon user stated</a>, \"[...] ever since I started using the Essie base coat ... it has protected my nails and made even the cheapest nail polish go on smoother and keeps them from staining my nails.\"</p>\n\tAn inexpensive nail polish brand\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5c8ff2cb4f07ae1b3d4f1bd2?format=jpeg\" alt=\"SinfulColors\" height=\"672\" width=\"896\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">SinfulColors</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>SinfulColors Professionals nail polish, available at <a href=\"http://goto.target.com/c/196318/81938/2092?subId1=biip_031819_at-home-manicure&#38;u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.target.com%2Fp%2Fsinful-colors-professional-nail-polish-0-5-fl-oz%2F-%2FA-53732772%3Fpreselect%3D16640108%23lnk%3Dsametab\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored\">Harmon Face Values</a> or <a href=\"http://goto.target.com/c/196318/81938/2092?subId1=biip_031819_at-home-manicure&#38;u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.target.com%2Fp%2Fsinful-colors-professional-nail-polish-0-5-fl-oz%2F-%2FA-53732772%3Fpreselect%3D16640108%23lnk%3Dsametab\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored\">Target for $1.99</a></h3><p>You don't need to spend a ton of money on a nail polish color to get a salon-grade manicure. Personally, I would never spend more than a few bucks on paint for my nails. <a href=\"http://goto.target.com/c/196318/81938/2092?subId1=biip_031819_at-home-manicure&#38;u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.target.com%2Fp%2Fsinful-colors-professional-nail-polish-0-5-fl-oz%2F-%2FA-53732772%3Fpreselect%3D16640108%23lnk%3Dsametab\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored\">SinfulColors</a> is not only inexpensive coming in at just $1.99 a bottle, but it's also just as durable as its competitors that are two and three times the price.</p><p><a href=\"https://www.makeupalley.com/product/showreview.asp/ItemId=6406/Nail-Polish-(all-colors)/SinfulColors/Polishes\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">A reviewer on MakeupAlly wrote</a>, \"I recently used one (Ruby Ruby) and kept it on for six whole days with ZERO chipping.\" Another user wrote, \"This product was easy to use and dried fairly quickly. Durability seems to be three to seven days depending on what you're doing [...]\"</p><p>The amount of time that passes before you start chipping heavily depends on what your daily activities are like.&#160;</p><p>Read on to the last two slides to find out how I take a $2 nail polish and make it look salon-grade.</p>\n\tA fast-drying top coat\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5c8ff3ec003f5c0ecc6db83a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"INM Out the Door\" height=\"765\" width=\"1020\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">INM Nails</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://goto.target.com/c/196318/81938/2092?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.target.com%2Fp%2Finm-out-the-door-super-fast-dry-top-coat-0-5-fl-oz%2F-%2FA-16831182\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored\">INM Out the Door clear top coat, available at Target for $4.99</a></h3><p>This topcoat might be the sole reason why my nails come out looking salon-fresh. You should never have to spend more than about $5 on this magical-manicure finishing polish. Not only does this clear top coat create a sleek, shiny finish to your manicure, but it dries quickly without the need for a UV light.</p><p>INM advertises that just one coat of <a href=\"https://goto.target.com/c/196318/81938/2092?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.target.com%2Fp%2Finm-out-the-door-super-fast-dry-top-coat-0-5-fl-oz%2F-%2FA-16831182\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored\">Out the Door</a> dries in 45 seconds and two coats in 90 seconds, but I'll be the first to say that this statement is only somewhat true. To the touch, the top coat does dry that fast, but if you want to use your hands right away, I suggest waiting closer to 10 minutes. I know that seems like a big difference, but I can't tell you how many times I've painted my nails (without a top coat) and went to bed four hours later only to wake up with pillow marks all over my nails. If you wait 10 minutes, you'll be able to go about your day without fear of ruining your at-home manicure.</p><p>How I use this product: After applying two coats of an inexpensive nail polish color, I use just one moderately generous coat of <a href=\"https://goto.target.com/c/196318/81938/2092?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.target.com%2Fp%2Finm-out-the-door-super-fast-dry-top-coat-0-5-fl-oz%2F-%2FA-16831182\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored\">Out the Door</a>. Then, I usually hop on social media and watch a few videos or make a phone call, and before I know it, my nails are good to go and I can walk right out the door ... get it?</p>\n\tA cuticle remover\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5c8ff6025b066e101b55d126?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Sally Hansen Cuticle Remover\" height=\"601\" width=\"801\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Sally Hansen</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"http://goto.target.com/c/196318/81938/2092?subId1=biip_031819_at-home-manicure&#38;u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.target.com%2Fp%2Fsally-hansen-nail-treatment-45129-instant-cuticle-remover-1-fl-oz%2F-%2FA-52476243\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored\">Sally Hansen Instant Cuticle Remover, available at Target for $4.99</a></h3><p>I put this product at the end for the sole fact that I personally don't touch my cuticles since they get pushed back and removed from my daily activities anyway. They don't personally bother me so I leave them be. On top of that, I wouldn't recommend using this product on a weekly basis or every time you paint your nails, but it's a great house keeping tool.</p><p>The <a href=\"http://goto.target.com/c/196318/81938/2092?subId1=biip_031819_at-home-manicure&#38;u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.target.com%2Fp%2Fsally-hansen-nail-treatment-45129-instant-cuticle-remover-1-fl-oz%2F-%2FA-52476243\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow nofollow sponsored\">Sally Hansen Instant Cuticle Remover</a> was recommended to me by a coworker <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/author/megan-foster\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Megan Foster</a>, a self-proclaimed nail enthusiast, who said, \"I discovered the Sally Hansen cuticle remover at my local Target and since then, it's been hard to tell the difference between an at-home and salon manicure. It's easy to apply, works in a few seconds, and leaves my cuticles looking refreshed and clean.\"</p><p>To use this product, simple apply a thin strip of the gel formula to each cuticle. After 15 seconds, push back the cuticles using a cotton-wrapped manicure stick. The formula features Chamomile and Aloe, so your cuticles and skin stay nourished to give you that salon-grade finish.</p><p><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/customer-reviews/R2TL04QHHMT1DQ/ref=cm_cr_dp_d_rvw_ttl?ie=UTF8&#38;ASIN=B00CS65RNO&#38;_encoding=UTF8&#38;tag=biip_031819_at-home-manicure-20&#38;linkCode=ur2&#38;linkId=7b66f1caa749429a7a2e05b48387bcb3&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored\">One Amazon user wrote</a>, \"Within seconds of applying it to my nails, the cuticle becomes soft and I can remove it right away. I used to never remove my cuticles when doing my nails, I guess because I didn't really know how to, but since I started using this product, my nails look so good.\" <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/customer-reviews/R2D7WNYQD0ZAL6/ref=cm_cr_dp_d_rvw_ttl?ie=UTF8&#38;ASIN=B00CS65RNO&#38;_encoding=UTF8&#38;tag=biip_031819_at-home-manicure-20&#38;linkCode=ur2&#38;linkId=ab1a9865e2cfec8294e34e510d0ac78e&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored\">While another Amazon user said</a>, \"I have been using this for years. I don't like having my cuticles cut and this works really well to clean up my cuticles.\"</p>\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a 0_3/2020/08/31/17-21-57-886_336c65ae9f1f5eef.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/KVoZh4v-CsI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn47@2020_6/2020/08/31/17-22-07-386_d95f174007b8527e.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598894512871},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 01:21:52","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 01:21:52","title":"Elon Musk's family includes a model, several millionaire entrepreneurs, and multiple sets of twins. Here are the members of the Musk family tree.","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/elon-musk-family-maye-musk-kimbal-musk-grimes-talulah-riley-2020-5","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5eb31701cdfd4814b8048885?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Elon Musk Maye Musk\" height=\"2044\" width=\"2725\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Elon Musk with his mother, Maye Musk.\n<p class=\"copyright\">REUTERS/Danny Moloshok</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>Tesla and SpaceX CEO Elon Musk has a large family that includes multiple millionaire entrepreneurs and several sets of twins.&#160;</li><li>Musk, who has been <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/elon-musk-relationships-2017-11\">married twice and has five sons</a>, has a new member of the family: <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/elon-musk-grimes-baby-name-sex-picture-2020-4\">a baby boy</a> with his partner, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/elon-musk-girlfriend-grimes-relationship-photos-2018-8\">the musician Grimes</a>.&#160;</li><li>Musk also has two siblings, Kimbal and Tosca; his mother, Maye, is a model; and his cousins have sold two companies for millions of dollars.&#160;</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li></ul><p>Elon Musk has had <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/the-rise-of-elon-musk-2016-7\">a wild life</a>, but he's not the only one in his family who launched businesses, made millions, or achieved fame.&#160;</p><p>Musk's family, who hails from South Africa and Canada is chock-full of entrepreneurs and rebels, from his filmmaker sister Tosca to his actress ex-wife, Talulah Riley. Now, the Tesla and SpaceX CEO has a new member of the family: <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/elon-musk-grimes-baby-name-sex-picture-2020-4\">a baby boy born in May</a> with his girlfriend, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/elon-musk-girlfriend-grimes-relationship-photos-2018-8\">the musician Grimes</a>.&#160;</p><p>Musk, who was <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/the-rise-of-elon-musk-2016-7\">born in Pretoria, Sou</a>t<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/the-rise-of-elon-musk-2016-7\">h Africa</a>, before emigrating to Canada, and eventually, California, has already had <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/elon-musk-relationships-2017-11\">a large immediate family</a> that included two ex-wives, a set of twins, and a set of triplets.&#160;</p><p>Here's a closer look at the Musk family tree.</p>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tErrol Musk, Elon Musk's father, is an engineer from South Africa.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5eb2d46048d92c6bfc5b8d38?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Errol Musk\" height=\"1610\" width=\"2147\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Errol Musk.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Denver Post Photo by Cyrus McCrimmon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Errol Musk, according to Elon, has a genius-level IQ and was reportedly the youngest person to earn a professional engineer's qualification in South Africa, according to <a href=\"https://www.rollingstone.com/culture/culture-features/elon-musk-the-architect-of-tomorrow-120850/\">a 2017 Rolling Stone profile</a>.&#160;</p><p>When Elon was a child, he moved in with his dad after this parents divorced. At the time, Errol Musk was working in construction and emerald mining, according to Rolling Stone.&#160;</p><p>Errol Musk <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/elon-musk-dad-errol-fathered-child-with-stepdaughter-2018-3\">made headlines in 2018</a> when it was revealed that he had a child with his then-30-year-old former stepdaughter Jana Bezuidenhout, whom he's known since she was 4 years old.</p><p>Today, Musk and Errol are estranged. The Tesla CEO told Rolling Stone that his father is \"a terrible human being.\" \"You have no idea about how bad,\" Musk said. \"Almost every crime you can possibly think of, he has done.\"</p>\n\tMaye Musk, Elon Musk's mother, is a dietitian and model.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5eb2cd86cdfd48655a68c1e8?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Maye Musk\" height=\"1975\" width=\"2633\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Maye Musk.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Danny Moloshok/Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Maye Musk has been modeling for over five decades, since age 15. She has appeared on boxes of Special K cereal and the cover of Time magazine, and has walked in shows at New York Fashion Week, according to <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2017/09/27/fashion/covergirl-maye-musk-elon-musk.html\">The New York Times</a>.&#160;</p><p>In 2017, Musk <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2017/09/27/fashion/covergirl-maye-musk-elon-musk.html\">became a CoverGirl spokesperson</a> at age 69.&#160;</p><p>Maye Musk was married to Errol Musk <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/01/fashion/elon-musk-mother-maye-musk-model-met-gala.html\">until 1979</a>, and she has <a href=\"https://www.harpersbazaar.com/celebrity/a29663489/maye-musk-memoir-interview-2019/\">described the relationship as abusive</a>. After they divorced, Maye Musk <a href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2018/06/01/elon-musks-mom-worked-5-jobs-to-raise-3-kids-after-her-divorce.html\">moved to Canada along with her three children</a>, where she built a business as a dietitian.&#160;</p>\n\tKimbal Musk is Elon Musk's younger brother. He's a restaurateur and philanthropist.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e4d48ed2687fc556b602123?format=jpeg\" alt=\"kimbal musk elon musk brother\" height=\"2120\" width=\"2827\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Kimbal Musk.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Fred Prouser/Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Kimbal Musk is currently <a href=\"http://www.kimbalmusk.com/about\">the founder of three food companies</a>: The Kitchen Restaurant Group, a nonprofit called Big Green, and Square Roots, an urban farming company.&#160;</p><p>Musk moved from South Africa to Canada along with Elon Musk when he was a teenager, eventually founding Zip2 with Elon and <a href=\"http://www.nytimes.com/1999/02/17/business/compaq-buys-zip2-to-enhance-altavista.html\">selling it for $307 million</a> in 1999. He was an investor in PayPal, and currently sits on the board of Tesla and SpaceX.&#160;</p><p>Kimbal Musk went on to enroll in the French Culinary Institute in New York, and after breaking his neck in a tubing accident in 2010, decided to devote his career to food, according to <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2017/10/16/dining/kimbal-musk-food.html\">The New York Times</a>.&#160;</p><p>Musk has been married twice: <a href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/forbestreptalks/2016/07/14/kimbal-musk-on-how-silicon-valley-taught-him-to-run-restaurants-and-why-his-brother-elon-will-win/#898313f7c2a7\">first to Jen Lewin</a>, with whom he created The Kitchen Restaurant Group and Big Green. They have three children together &#8212; <a href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/SB10001424052970203771904574179751802508982\">two sons</a> named Luca and August, and a third child whose name is unknown.&#160;</p><p>Musk <a href=\"https://dallas.culturemap.com/news/restaurants-bars/04-09-18-cedar-social-wedding-reception-kimbal-musk-christiana-wyly/\">married Christiana Wyly,</a> the daughter of ex-billionaire Sam Wyly, in 2018&#160;at in \"intimate\" wedding in Dallas.&#160;</p>\n\tTosca Musk, Elon Musk's younger sister, runs a streaming service called Passionflix.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5eb2d3f0cdfd486a386e6a5b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Tosca Musk\" height=\"1786\" width=\"2381\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Tosca Musk.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Araya Diaz/Getty Images for PASSIONFLIX</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Tosca Musk has been producing movies since 2001, and has made more than 30 to date, according to her&#160;<a href=\"https://www.imdb.com/name/nm0994379/\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"60\">IMDb page.</a></p><p>She is currently the cofounder and CEO of Passionflix, a streaming service for movies that have been adapted from romance novels.&#160;Musk founded the company in 2016 and has raised over $4 million from investors that include Kimbal Musk.&#160;</p><p>Musk is unmarried and has two children, twins named <a href=\"https://twitter.com/ToscaMusk/status/1082336017355423745?s=20\">Isabeau and Grayson</a>.&#160;</p>\n\tLyndon Rive is the cofounder of SolarCity and Elon Musk's cousin.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5eb31843cdfd481597387392?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Lyndon Rive\" height=\"2003\" width=\"2671\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Lyndon Rive.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Rashid Umar Abbasi/Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Lyndon Rive, along with his brother Peter, cofounded SolarCity in 2006. He served as the company's CEO until after the company was <a href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2016/08/01/teslas-solarcity-acquisition-continues-to-divide-opinion.html\">acquired by Tesla for $2.6 billion</a> in 2016. Rive stayed on as the head of sales for Tesla's energy division <a href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-tesla-solar-rive/former-solarcity-ceo-lyndon-rive-will-leave-tesla-idUSKCN18B2RP\">until 2017</a>.</p><p>Prior to launching SolarCity, Rive founded a software company called Everdream with his brothers, Russ and Peter, in 1999. They sold it to Dell eight years later <a href=\"https://fortune.com/2014/10/09/lyndon-rive-solar-city/\">for $120 million</a>.&#160;</p><p>&#160;</p>\n\tPeter Rive is also a SolarCity cofounder and a cousin of Musk's.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5eb318bc5f726e14573ab973?format=jpeg\" alt=\"peter rive elon musk\" height=\"707\" width=\"943\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Peter Rive.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Mark Von Holden/AP Images for SolarCity</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Peter Rive, SolarCity's cofounder and CTO, left Tesla <a href=\"https://www.fastcompany.com/40442070/peter-rive-solarcity-cofounder-and-elon-musks-cousin-is-leaving-tesla\">eight months after</a> it acquired SolarCity.&#160;</p><p>In February 2019, both Lyndon and Peter Rive <a href=\"https://medium.com/zolaelectric/lyndon-rive-peter-rive-co-founders-of-solarcity-now-tesla-energy-join-zola-electric-%EF%B8%8F-166d586e4529\">joined Zola Electric</a>, a startup focused on bringing clean, affordable energy to Africa.</p>\n\tRuss Rive is the founder of an art and technical production company called SuperUber. He's also a cousin of Musk's.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5eb31d1c48d92c1a3534a908?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Russ Rive\" height=\"793\" width=\"1057\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Russ Rive.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brandon Williams/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Russ Rive cofounded software company called Everdream with his brothers, Lyndon and Peter. He's since cofounded production company SuperUber, which counts <a href=\"https://superuber.com/about/\">Tesla and SpaceX among its clients.</a></p>\n\tAlmeda Rive is Russ, Peter, and Lyndon's sister.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5eb31ffb5f726e18ae742f05?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Dirtbike\" height=\"1950\" width=\"2600\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A competitive dirt-bike rider, but not Almeda Rive.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Mustafa Bayer/Anadolu Agency via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Almeda Rive is a competitive dirt-bike rider, according to <a href=\"https://www.vanityfair.com/news/2015/10/elon-musk-family-maye-musk\">Vanity Fair</a>, and also worked in sales at SolarCity, according to <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/almeda-rive-9145446/\">LinkedIn</a>.&#160;</p>\n\tJustine Musk is an author and Elon Musk's first wife.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5eb2d57acdfd486b222050f7?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Justine Musk\" height=\"1014\" width=\"1352\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Justine Musk.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Ryan Miller/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Justine Wilson met Elon Musk while they were attending Queen's University in Kingston, Ontario. While Musk eventually transferred to the Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania, they reconnected as Musk started working on his first startup and Justine started working on her first novel after graduation.</p><p>They got married in 2000, according to Justine Musk's <a href=\"http://www.marieclaire.com/sex-love/a5380/millionaire-starter-wife/\">essay in Marie Claire</a>.&#160;</p><p>The couple eventually moved to Los Angeles and had a son named Nevada, whom <a href=\"https://www.marieclaire.com/sex-love/a5380/millionaire-starter-wife/\">they lost to SIDS</a> when he was 10 weeks old. They ultimately had twins and triplets &#8212; <a href=\"https://www.forbes.com/pictures/mkm45figed/elon-musk-4/#19c1a75662ba\">five sons in total</a> &#8212; named Griffin, Xavier, Damian, Saxon, and Kai.</p><p>Justine Musk wrote in Marie Claire that she was a \"stater wife,\" and described her and Musk's relationship as unhealthy. The couple <a href=\"https://moschus.livejournal.com/102961.html\">divorced in 2008</a>.</p>\n\tTalulah Riley is a British actress. She and Musk have been married twice.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5eb2cf5442278d61741b38ca?format=jpeg\" alt=\"elon musk talulah riley kids\" height=\"1125\" width=\"1500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Elon Musk, Talulah Riley, Kimbal Musk, and two of Elon Musk&#39;s sons.\n<p class=\"copyright\">AP</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>After Musk's divorce from Justine, the tech mogul began dating actress Talulah Riley. They got engaged <a href=\"https://www.marieclaire.com/sex-love/a5380/millionaire-starter-wife/\">six weeks later</a>.</p><p>Riley and Musk married in 2010. Two years later, news of their divorce became public when <a href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/hannahelliott/2012/01/18/elon-musk-to-divorce-wife-talulah-riley/#3bb5e52671b2\">Musk tweeted</a>: \"It was an amazing four years. I will love you forever. You will make someone very happy one day\" at Riley on Twitter.</p><p>The couple remarried in 2013. Musk filed for &#8212; then withdrew &#8212; a second divorce the following year. In 2016, <a href=\"http://www.rollingstone.com/culture/features/elon-musk-inventors-plans-for-outer-space-cars-finding-love-w511747\">Riley filed for divorce</a> from Musk, which was <a href=\"https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/10/22/elon-musk-and-talulah-riley-divorce-for-a-second-time/\">finalized later that year</a>.</p><p>The two remained on good terms, however. \"We still see each other all the time and take care of each other,\" she told <a href=\"http://people.com/celebrity/elon-musks-ex-talulah-riley-on-reconciliation-following-amber-heard-sighting/\">People</a>.</p>\n\tGrimes, whose real name is Claire Boucher, started dating Elon Musk in 2018.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5eb2f66bcdfd4802ec49afc4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Grimes\" height=\"1400\" width=\"1867\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Grimes.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Frazer Harrison/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>In May 2018, Musk arrived at the annual Costume Institute Gala at the Metropolitan Museum of Art alongside Grimes, the Canadian singer and producer. At the time, <a href=\"https://pagesix.com/2018/05/07/elon-musk-quietly-dating-musician-grimes/\">Page Six</a> reported that the pair had been \"quietly dating\" for a few weeks.</p><p>The couple <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/elon-musk-girlfriend-grimes-relationship-photos-2018-8\">met over Twitter</a> when Musk was planning to make a joke about artificial intelligence and discovered Grimes had beaten him to the punch.</p><p>In January 2020, Grimes <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/grimes-elon-musk-pregnant-instagram-post-indicates-2020-1\">posted a partially nude photo</a> to her Instagram and Twitter accounts that showed her pregnant with a fetus Photoshopped on her belly. She later confirmed she and Musk were having a baby, who was <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/elon-musk-grimes-baby-name-sex-picture-2020-4\">born on May 4</a>. The couple says they <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/x-ae-a-12-elon-musk-grimes-baby-name-meaning-2020-5\">named their son X &#198; A-Xii</a>, which is partially a reference to a CIA plane nicknamed \"Archangel.\"&#160;</p>\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a /~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn51@2020_3/2020/08/31/17-22-14-421_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=pBEVWF4TyvA:8nc2fRgvuQg:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn79@2020_1/2020/08/31/17-22-20-191_47818e06ff1d71d1.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=pBEVWF4TyvA:8nc2fRgvuQg:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn47@2020_1/2020/08/31/17-21-57-711_cf7f52a46e861269.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn76@2020_1/2020/08/31/17-22-07-798_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=pBEVWF4TyvA:8nc2fRgvuQg:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn71@2020_5/2020/08/31/17-22-00-036_ae9a65e91c4abc93.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/pBEVWF4TyvA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn51@2020_4/2020/08/31/17-22-16-045_10385e5b1a6826ed.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598894512893},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 01:21:52","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 01:21:52","title":"One chart shows how July's housing surge doesn't change the fact that America is still building fewer houses than it has in the past","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/chart-showing-historical-housing-starts-2020-8","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f48203acd2fec00296a4add?format=jpeg\" alt=\"housing construction and development\" height=\"1333\" width=\"1778\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Development and construction continues on a large scale housing project of over 600 homes in Oceanside, California, U.S., June 25, 2018.\n<p class=\"copyright\">REUTERS/Mike Blake</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>Housing starts <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/us-housing-starts-exceed-july-forecasts-jump-most-since-2016-2020-8\">increased by 22.6% from 1.2 million in June to 1.5 million in July</a>, continuing a three-month rise in new housing construction for privately-owned units.&#160;</li><li>Despite this climb in housing starts, this figure is still low compared to previous decades.</li><li>The following chart highlights the number of privately-owned housing starts since the 1990s.</li><li>Although new housing construction has increased since the end of the Great Recession, housing starts are still lower than figures from the 1990s and 2000s.</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li></ul><p>Privately-owned housing starts saw <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/us-housing-starts-exceed-july-forecasts-jump-most-since-2016-2020-8\">another month of gains</a> in July, after a massive downturn earlier in the spring during the early days of the pandemic.</p><p>US housing starts increased by 22.6% from a revised 1.22 million in June to 1.5 million in July. This is also a 23.4% year-over-year increase from last July's new housing construction of 1.21 million.</p><p>As Business Insider's <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/us-housing-starts-exceed-july-forecasts-jump-most-since-2016-2020-8\">Carmen Reinicke</a> previously reported, housing demand and low mortgage rates are contributing to this rise in new home construction.&#160;</p><p>Even though this number is the highest monthly figure since housing starts tumbled 26.4% between <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/us-housing-starts-fell-april-most-record-house-market-coronavirus-2020-5\">March&#160;and April</a>, it is still lower than historical levels. Before the pandemic even hit, housing starts were below figures reported in previous decades.</p><p>The following chart highlights housing starts of privately-owned homes from January 1990 to July 2020. During this time period, new construction peaked at the top of the mid-aughts housing bubble in January 2006 at 2.3 million:</p><div class=\"insider-raw-embed\"><iframe title=\"Privately-owned new homes started\" aria-label=\"Interactive line chart\" id=\"datawrapper-chart-pPpdG\" src=\"https://datawrapper.dwcdn.net/pPpdG/1/\" scrolling=\"no\" frameborder=\"0\" style=\"width: 0; min-width: 100% ; border: none;\" height=\"450\"></iframe><script type=\"text/javascript\">!function(){\"use strict\";window.addEventListener(\"message\",(function(a){if(void 0!==a.data[\"datawrapper-height\"])for(var e in a.data[\"datawrapper-height\"]){var t=document.getElementById(\"datawrapper-chart-\"+e)||document.querySelector(\"iframe[src*='\"+e+\"']\");t&&(t.style.height=a.data[\"datawrapper-height\"][e]+\"px\")}}))}();</script></div><p>&#160;</p><p>Housing construction rates during the 1990s and 2000s were consistently higher than rates since the Great Recession. New housing construction was higher than the latest July figure of 1.5 million for the majority of the months between September 1997 to the end of 2006.&#160;</p><p>The bubble of rising housing prices during the mid-aughts contributed to this increase in new homes being built at such high rates. The <a href=\"https://cepr.net/documents/publications/housing_fact_2005_07.pdf\">Center for Economic and Policy Research</a> predicted that after the housing bubble burst, there would be a drop in construction similar to the recession in the early '80s. Since then, housing starts have not been able to climb back up to such high levels.</p><p>The chart shows that despite a growing population &#8212; the <a href=\"https://www.census.gov/data/tables/time-series/demo/popest/2010s-national-total.html\">US population</a> increased by 6.1% from 2010 to 2019, according to the Census Bureau &#8212; new housing construction has been low in recent years. &#160;After declining from January 2006, housing starts mainly climbed back up since the end of the Great Recession until last January, which had 1.6 million housing starts. Housing starts then fell during the coronavirus pandemic.</p><p>A pre-coronavirus analysis by the <a href=\"http://eyeonhousing.org/2020/01/a-decade-of-home-building-the-long-recovery-of-the-2010s/\">National Association of Home Builders</a> looked back at single-family and multifamily housing starts over the past decades. The author said that housing construction couldn't meet demand after the Great Recession, and that during the 2010s \"low levels of production also occurred with falling vacancy rates, declining housing affordability, and rising building costs.\"</p><p>His analysis argued that low homeownership demand during the first half of the decade while more people were looking to rent may have also contributed to the low level of new homebuilding relative to other decades and despite a rising population. Multifamily housing starts recovered first and homeownership demand increased during the second half of the decade.</p><p>Carmen Reinicke <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/us-housing-starts-fell-april-most-record-house-market-coronavirus-2020-5\">reported</a> in May after housing starts dropped to 934,000 in April from 1.3 million in March that Joel Kan, the Mortgage Bankers Association's associate vice president of economic and industry forecasting, said \"tight\" housing supplies and job losses in the sector may mean a slow rebound in housing construction.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/chart-showing-historical-housing-starts-2020-8'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=VriiluZamHA:LkWk7eL-6pA:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=VriiluZamHA:LkWk7eL-6pA:F7zBnMyn0Lo\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=VriiluZamHA:LkWk7eL-6pA:F7zBnMyn0Lo\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=VriiluZamHA:LkWk7eL-6pA:V_sGLiPBpWU\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=VriiluZamHA:LkWk7eL-6pA:V_sGLiPBpWU\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 31 Aug 2020 13:33:59 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f48203acd2fec00296a4add?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"11e3ff42a6296390de97672d3f530593","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn73@2020_6/2020/08/31/17-21-53-568_b9a2cb68f3095da5.webp","destWidth":1778,"destHeight":1333,"sourceBytes":353052,"destBytes":353052,"author":"insider@insider.com (Madison Hoff)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f48203acd2fec00296a4add?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn73@2020_6/2020/08/31/17-21-53-568_b9a2cb68f3095da5.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn51@2020_3/2020/08/31/17-22-14-421_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=VriiluZamHA:LkWk7eL-6pA:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn71@2020_1/2020/08/31/17-22-08-857_18041b058c4957c9.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=VriiluZamHA:LkWk7eL-6pA:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn27@2020_6/2020/08/31/17-21-55-742_971344b064176182.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn76@2020_1/2020/08/31/17-22-07-798_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=VriiluZamHA:LkWk7eL-6pA:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn60@2020_1/2020/08/31/17-22-02-007_8930db699b734893.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/VriiluZamHA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn35@2020_4/2020/08/31/17-22-07-464_276b4b9f94fc47a7.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598894512909},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 01:21:52","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 01:21:52","title":"Pirated versions of 'Tenet' have appeared online ahead of the movie's US debut","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/pirated-versions-of-tenet-appear-online-before-us-debut-2020-8","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f46344942f43f001ddff0e2?format=jpeg\" alt=\"JOHN DAVID WASHINGTON in Warner Bros. Pictures’ action epic &#34;TENET,&#34; a Warner Bros. Pictures release.\" height=\"1105\" width=\"1600\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>John David Washington in &#34;Tenet.&#34;\n<p class=\"copyright\">Melinda Sue Gordon / Warner Bros.</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>Low-quality pirated versions of \"Tenet\" appeared online over the weekend after it debuted in some international theatrical markets, according to Variety and TorrentFreak.</li><li>The versions appear to stem from two sources, one with Korean subtitles and one with German subtitles, according to TorrentFreak.</li><li>\"Tenet\" grossed a positive $53 million internationally over the weekend. It hits US theaters this weekend where they are open.</li><li>Pirated versions of \"The New Mutants\" also appeared online, according to Variety. The movie earned $10 million globally over the weekend.</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li></ul><p>Warner Bros.' \"Tenet\" finally hit theaters in some international markets last week after several delays, and has already made its way online.</p><p>Low-quality pirated versions of the Christopher Nolan movie have appeared online, according to <a href=\"https://variety.com/2020/film/news/tenet-new-mutants-pirated-versions-1234754517/\">Variety</a> and <a href=\"https://torrentfreak.com/pirated-copies-of-tenet-leak-online-for-real-200831/\">TorrentFreak</a>. The latter reported that the videos appear to come from two sources: one with Korean subtitles and one \"sponsored by a gambling company\" with German subtitles.</p><p>Warner Bros. has been quick to act recently to similar circumstances, removing \"Tenet\" footage that leaked from screenings of \"Inception's\" rerelease earlier this month, as well as fake pirated versions of \"Tenet\" from torrent sites, according to TorrentFreak.</p><p>Warner Bros. did not immediately respond to a request for comment.</p><p>Online movie piracy isn't a new phenomenon but has seen a spike in certain cases during the pandemic. For instance, the 2011 movie \"Contagion,\" about a deadly virus, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/coronavirus-contagion-movie-is-surging-in-piracy-rentals-on-itunes-2020-3\">surged in piracy streaming</a> in the early weeks of the coronavirus outbreak, according to the piracy analytics company MUSO.</p><p>While Hollywood has had to deal with piracy for years, the stakes are higher for movie studios during the pandemic, as some audiences remain wary of returning to traditional theaters. According to a <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/us-moviegoers-not-comfortable-going-to-theaters-amc-regal-reopen-2020-8\">recent Morning Consult survey</a> of 2,200 US adults, only 17% said they would feel comfortable returning to a theater right now.</p><p>But \"Tenet\" could convince some to return, if early box-office data is an indication. The movie grossed a positive $53 million internationally over the weekend. It debuts in US theaters on Friday where local governments have allowed them to reopen amid the coronavirus pandemic. Major theater chains opened their doors for the first time in five months earlier this month.</p><p>Pirated versions of \"The New Mutants,\" which <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/x-men-movie-new-mutants-released-after-delays-box-office-2020-8\">debuted over the weekend</a>, have also appeared online, according to Variety. The long-delayed movie earned $7 million in the US and $10 million globally.&#160;</p><p>While \"The New Mutants\" and the road-rage thriller \"Unhinged\" have fared well at the box office considering the obstacles, their top venues in the US <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/top-venues-for-unhinged-movie-were-all-drive-ins-2020-8\">have been drive-in theaters</a>, suggesting that audiences largely may not be ready to return to traditional theaters yet.</p><p>\"Tenet,\" a much anticipated blockbuster, will put that to the test.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on watch","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/the-latest-coronavirus-and-commercial-real-estate-news-2020-3","description":"<figure> \n <img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5eb8045842278d29a8641012?format=jpeg\" alt=\"hudson yards\" height=\"3168\" width=\"4224\" charset=\"\"> \n  <figcaption>\n   Some big firms are rethinking office needs — and some commercial real-estate deals have been put on ice as financing dries up. Coworking and flex-office firms are struggling under big rent obligations after years of rapid growth. \n   <p class=\"copyright\">Katie Warren/Business Insider</p> \n  </figcaption> </img>\n</figure>\n<p>The coronavirus pandemic threw the real-estate world into disarray, as people emptied out of offices, hotels, and malls and worked from their homes. That disruption has transformed how people and companies finance, operate, and occupy real estate.&nbsp;</p>\n<p>Some big firms are rethinking office needs — and some commercial real-estate deals have been put on ice as financing dries up. Coworking and flex-office firms are struggling under big rent obligations after years of rapid growth.</p>\n<p>A surge in e-commerce, meanwhile, is fueling demand for warehouse and cold storage space as companies look for new ways to reach customers. And with the pandemic increasing the amount of food delivery and hurting restaurants' bottom lines, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/14-ghost-kitchen-companies-delivery-boom-restaurants-2020-7?r=realestate-teaser\">buzzy ghost kitchens</a> see an opportunity to grow.&nbsp;</p>\n<p>Still, companies like <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/ibm-advancing-search-for-nyc-office-space-hires-cushman-wakefield-2020-7?r=realestate-teaser\">IBM</a> and <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/facebook-signs-730000-square-foot-office-lease-at-farley-building-2020-8?r=realestate-teaser\">Facebook</a> have been pushing ahead with plans for big office spaces, showing that it may be too soon to call and end to the office. And <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/apple-negotiating-expand-manhattan-office-at-11-penn-plaza-2020-8?r=realestate-teaser\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Apple is in talks</a> to grow a Manhattan office that it leased earlier this year.</p>\n<p>Here's the latest news on how commercial and residential real-estate is being upended, and how experts think these markets will play out in the long run.&nbsp;</p>\n<p><em><strong>Have a tip about layoffs or major changes in this space?</strong> Contact this reporter through the secure messaging app Signal at +1 (646) 768-4772 using a non-work phone, email at <a href=\"mailto:mmorris@businessinsider.com\">anicoll@businessinsider.com</a>, or Twitter DM at&nbsp;<a href=\"https://twitter.com/MeghanEMorris\">@AlexONicoll</a>. From strategy-focused exec jobs to the red-hot industrial space, 4 recruiters lay out roles they're trying to fill.</a></li>\n <li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/the-four-power-players-who-run-blackstones-real-estate-business-2020-5?r=realestate-teaser\">Meet the 4 dealmakers driving Blackstone's $325 billion commercial real estate portfolio. They walked us through how they're thinking about opportunities in the downturn.</a></li>\n <li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/eastdil-secured-real-estate-deals-volumes-have-dropped-off-2020-5\">The CEO of real estate heavy-hitter Eastdil explains the types of deals that are must-do right now —&nbsp;and warns that a 'de-retailing' trend is set to accelerate</a></li>\n</ul>\n<h1>Tech office deals</h1>\n<ul>\n <li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/why-tech-companies-keep-adding-new-offices-while-working-remote-2020-8?r=realestate-teaser\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The Big Tech office isn't dead. It shows how tech is becoming a lone bright spot for a battered commercial real-estate market.</a></li>\n <li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/facebook-signs-730000-square-foot-office-lease-at-farley-building-2020-8?r=realestate-teaser\">Facebook just reached a blockbuster deal to lease the massive Farley Building in NYC as a tech and engineering hub. Here's why it's a huge win for a shaken office market.</a></li>\n <li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/facial-recognition-technology-in-offices-touchless-entry-coronavirus-2020-8?r=realestate-teaser\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Facial-recognition experts say the pandemic is a huge tipping point for office landlords embracing the tech. Here's how they're pitching the idea.</a></li>\n <li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/sl-green-puts-410-tenth-avenue-on-market-stock-buyback-2020-7?r=realestate-teaser\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">SL Green is looking to sell a $1.1 billion Amazon-anchored building to buy back its shares. Here's a look at its strategy to defend its share price as the office market tanks.</a></li>\n <li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/ibm-advancing-search-for-nyc-office-space-hires-cushman-wakefield-2020-7?r=realestate-teaser\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">IBM is on the hunt for a massive Manhattan space, showing that worries about the death of the big-city office may be overblown</a></li>\n <li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tenants-are-casting-office-space-onto-the-market-for-sublease-2020-6?r=realestate-teaser\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Companies from banks to tech giants are looking to shed huge chunks of office space. These are the 14 companies — and the money backing them — that you need to know.</a></li>\n</ul>\n<h1>Hotels and casinos</h1>\n<ul>\n <li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/korean-lenders-mirae-meritz-could-see-losses-us-hotel-loans-2020-8?r=realestate-teaser\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Investments in risky hotel debt could get wiped out as travel gets slammed — and one group of lenders may see an outsized hit</a></li>\n <li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/wells-fargo-barings-other-lenders-are-selling-off-hotel-loans-2020-7?r=realestate-teaser\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">A growing group of lenders are looking to unload hundreds of millions of dollars of souring hotel loans. Then the pandemic emptied campuses and turned that thesis on its head.</a></li>\n</ul>\n<h1>Warehouses and logistics</h1>\n<ul>\n <li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/neighbor-airbnb-self-storage-empty-office-space-commercial-real-estate-2020-8?r=realestate-teaser\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Neighbor, an Andreessen Horowitz-backed startup that wants to be the Airbnb of self-storage, has started partnering with landlords to turn empty offices into spaces for people's stuff</a></li>\n <li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/lineage-logistics-new-cold-warehouse-deals-delivery-logistics-real-estate-2020-8?r=realestate-teaser\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Cold storage is 2020's red-hot real estate play. Here's how the private-equity backed industry leader is spending $500 million to tighten its grip on the market.</a></li>\n <li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/big-tenants-amazon-logistics-demand-cold-storage-spaces-grocery-delivery-2020-7?r=realestate-teaser\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Real estate developers are building costly cold storage space before they even have tenants. They're betting the risky move could be a winning investment as grocery delivery booms.</a></li>\n <li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/bond-logistics-startup-warehouses-softbank-reef-ecommerce-parking-lots-2020-7?r=realestate-teaser\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Logistics startup Bond has teamed up with SoftBank-backed REEF Technology to bring nano-warehouses to parking lots across the US. 01:21:52","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 01:21:52","title":"Trump's $300 unemployment benefit is set to be paid in 34 states. But the program may only provide aid for just over a month.","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-unemployment-benefit-states-jobless-aid-lost-wages-lasts-month-2020-8","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4d086560bf1f002807971f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"U.S. President Donald Trump speaks prior to signing an executive order on police reform at a ceremony in the Rose Garden at the White House in Washington, U.S., June 16, 2020. REUTERS/Leah Millis\" height=\"1099\" width=\"2198\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>U.S. President Trump signs executive order on police reform at the White House in Washington\n<p class=\"copyright\">Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>Most states have been approved to distribute federal aid under Trump's $300 unemployment aid program.</li><li>It'll be $400 in a few states since they were given the option to provide an extra $100 in weekly benefits.</li><li>Thirty-four states are scheduled to begin paying out the money in the coming weeks, including California, Florida, Iowa, New York, Ohio, and Oregon.</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li></ul><p>A majority of states have been approved to take part in President Donald Trump's unemployment aid program, which was implemented under an executive order he signed earlier this month.</p><p>States have until September 10 to apply for the Lost Wages Assistance program through the Federal Emergency Management Administration. It's working alongside state workforce agencies to distribute the payments retroactive to August 1.</p><p>The weekly federal supplement is $300, but states are given the option to kick in another $100 <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-administration-unemployment-benefit-boost-blowback-states-governors-2020-8\">under revised guidelines</a> from the Trump administration. A provision also mandates people must receive at least $100 in weekly benefits to qualify for federal aid, which <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trumps-federal-unemployment-boost-leave-out-low-wage-workers-2020-8\">could exclude many</a> part-time and gig workers.</p><p>However, <a href=\"https://tcf.org/content/commentary/trumps-lost-wage-assistance-program-no-substitute-federal-unemployment-benefits/\">experts say the program</a> could provide only six weeks of unemployment aid once states get it up and running, which is expected to be in September for many at the earliest.</p><p>Here are the 34 states slated to begin paying out the money over the next several weeks as of Monday afternoon, per UnemploymentPUA, a website that's tracking program developments. States in bold are providing an extra $100 in jobless aid:</p><ul><li>Alabama</li><li>Alaska</li><li>Arkansas</li><li>California</li><li>Colorado</li><li>Connecticut</li><li>Florida</li><li>Georgia</li><li>Hawaii</li><li>Idaho</li><li>Indiana</li><li>Iowa&#160;</li><li><strong>Kentucky</strong></li><li>Maine</li><li>Maryland</li><li>Massachusetts</li><li>Michigan</li><li>Minnesota</li><li>Mississippi</li><li>New Hampshire</li><li>New Mexico</li><li>New York</li><li>North Carolina</li><li>Ohio</li><li>Oklahoma</li><li>Oregon</li><li>Pennsylvania</li><li>Rhode Island</li><li>Utah</li><li>Vermont</li><li>Virginia</li><li>Washington</li><li><strong>West Virginia</strong></li><li>Wyoming</li></ul><p>South Dakota is the only state so far that's announced it won't apply for the program, with state officials citing a job recovery. Kentucky, Montana, and West Virginia say they will disperse the full $400 amount. Kansas also signaled it would do the same, <a href=\"https://www.kansas.com/news/politics-government/article245294385.html\">the Wichita Eagle reported.</a></p><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong>&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/stock-market-crash-david-rosenberg-dot-com-tech-bubble-distortions-2020-8\" data-analytics-position=\"10\" data-analytics-module=\"\">35-year market vet David Rosenberg warns the stock market's rally features distortions that were glaring during the tech bubble &#8212; and lays out his plausible scenario for a crash</a></em></p><p>Only six states have begun distributing the aid to jobless people so far: Arizona, Louisiana, Missouri, Montana, Tennessee, and Texas.</p><p>Michele Evermore, a policy expert at the National Employment Law Project, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-unemployment-benefits-states-pay-wait-time-jobless-americans-stimulus-2020-8\">recently told Business Insider</a> that states are moving slowly to enact the program given how quickly the White House put it together.</p><p>\"I would be incredibly nervous to take money with so little guidance that came out so fast with so little forethought,\" she said. \"I think states are really, really making sure they're implementing this within the four corners of the law, and I don't blame them.\"</p><p>The $300 federal benefit is a 50% cut from the $600 supplement that was in place from late March to the end of July. It expired because of fierce disagreements between Republicans and Democrats in Congress over the amount it should be replaced with.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5eeb4a382618b97a446717c8?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"ef0652c23e9b8a18e155e4ad102189ac","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn68@2020_2/2020/08/31/17-22-06-547_8466ca7e92064ebc.webp","destWidth":1466,"destHeight":1099,"sourceBytes":67314,"destBytes":67314,"author":"jzeballos@businessinsider.com (Joseph Zeballos-Roig)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f4d086560bf1f002807971f?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn20@2020_2/2020/08/31/17-21-57-087_ea4ffef3deb7e2c9.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn51@2020_3/2020/08/31/17-22-14-421_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ijLRSR6q94M:EWyGInMMb3Q:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn35@2020_3/2020/08/31/17-22-09-860_7abec81a9d6ffeda.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ijLRSR6q94M:EWyGInMMb3Q:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn3@2020_1/2020/08/31/17-22-09-767_96ebb675a798f5a1.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn76@2020_1/2020/08/31/17-22-07-798_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ijLRSR6q94M:EWyGInMMb3Q:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn88@2020_3/2020/08/31/17-22-10-635_9723a62365ae0958.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/ijLRSR6q94M":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn52@2020_3/2020/08/31/17-22-17-446_3ddd059eb4722dbf.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598894512850},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 01:21:52","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 01:21:52","title":"In a monumental ruling, a federal appeals court denied Michael Flynn's motion to dismiss the DOJ's case against him","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/appeals-court-denies-michael-flynn-motion-to-dismiss-doj-case-2020-8","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4d24aa7ffa48002894d273?format=jpeg\" alt=\"FILE - In this Dec. 1, 2017, file photo, former President Donald Trump national security adviser Michael Flynn leaves federal court in Washington. The Justice Department&#39;s dismissal of the Michael Flynn case has been swept up in a broader push by President Donald Trump and Republican allies to reframe the Russia investigation as a plot to sabotage his administration. (AP Photo/Susan Walsh, File)\" height=\"2100\" width=\"4200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>FILE - In this Dec. 1, 2017, file photo, former President Donald Trump national security adviser Michael Flynn leaves federal court in Washington. The Justice Department&#39;s dismissal of the Michael Flynn case has been swept up in a broader push by President Donald Trump and Republican allies to reframe the Russia investigation as a plot to sabotage his administration. (AP Photo/Susan Walsh, File)\n<p class=\"copyright\">Associated Press</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>A federal US appeals court denied former national security adviser Michael Flynn's motion to dismiss the Justice Department's case against him.</li><li>The order is a monumental defeat for Flynn and the Justice Department, whose lawyers have been arguing for the case's dismissal for months.</li><li>A three-judge panel from the appeals court initially ordered the judge overseeing Flynn's case to comply with the DOJ's motion to dismiss. But the full ten-member appeals court panel overturned that decision on Monday.</li><li>The case will now go back to US District Judge Emmet Sullivan, who had asked a veteran former judge and prosecutor to review the DOJ's motion to dismiss. Sullivan also planned to hold a hearing on the motion that was originally scheduled for July.</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li></ul><p>A federal US appeals court denied former national security adviser Michael Flynn's motion to dismiss the Justice Department's case against him. The order is a monumental defeat for Flynn, whose lawyers have been arguing for the case's dismissal for months.</p><p>Flynn pleaded guilty in December 2017 to lying to the FBI about his conversations with Russia's ambassador to the US at the time, Sergey Kislyak, regarding US sanctions against Russia.</p><p>The former national security adviser initially cooperated with Robert Mueller's investigators in the Russia probe. But he later shifted course by hiring new attorneys who took a more combative stance and asked to withdraw Flynn's guilty plea.</p><p>The DOJ also later changed tactics in the Flynn case over the objections of some of the original Mueller prosecutors and asked the judge overseeing the case to dismiss it, citing insufficient evidence against Flynn. The move prompted a swift outcry from House Democrats who said it was a political maneuver by Attorney General William Barr to shield Trump associates.</p><p>A three-judge panel from the DC circuit court of appeals initially ruled in Flynn and the DOJ's favor and ordered a lower court judge to toss out the case against the former national security adviser. But the full panel of judges <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/michael-flynn-loses-washington-dc-circuit-court-of-appeals-2020-7\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">decided to review Flynn's case last month</a>, marking a potential turning point in the proceedings, because the panel consists of more judges appointed by Democratic presidents (7) than those appointed by Republicans (3).</p><p>\"As to Petitioner's first two requests &#8212; to compel the immediate grant of the Government's motion, and to vacate the District Court's appointment of amicus &#8212; Petitioner has not established that he has 'no other adequate means to attain the relief he desires,'\" Monday's 8-2 ruling said. \"We also decline to mandate that the case be reassigned to a different district judge, because Petitioner has not established a clear and indisputable right to reassignment. We therefore deny the Petition.\"</p><p>The case will now go back to US District Judge Emmet Sullivan, who had previously asked a veteran former judge and prosecutor to review the DOJ's motion to dismiss. Sullivan also planned to hold a hearing on the motion that was originally scheduled for July.</p><p>John Gleeson, the former judge who examined the DOJ's motion, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/john-gleeson-files-brief-doj-motion-michael-flynn-case-2020-6\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">issued a scathing brief</a> in June saying the department \"engaged in highly irregular conduct to benefit a political ally of the President.\"</p><p>Gleeson added that the DOJ's claim that there wasn't enough evidence to prove Flynn made materially false statements \"taxes the credulity of the credulous\" and was \"conclusively disproven by its own briefs filed earlier in this very proceeding.\"</p><p>Gleeson added that the government's grounds for dismissing the case also \"contradict and ignore this Court's prior orders, which constitute law of the case. They are riddled with inexplicable and elementary errors of law and fact. And they depart from positions that the Government has taken in other cases.\"</p><p>There is also \"clear evidence of a gross abuse of prosecutorial power\" in the motion to dismiss, Gleeson wrote. Rule 48(a) of the federal rules of criminal procedure is meant to protect against \"dubious dismissals of criminal cases that would benefit powerful and well-connected defendants.\" However, that's exactly what's happened in Flynn's case, Gleeson added.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a
